  35class CenterLocator_new:

  37    
  38    def __init__(self, input_image, 
  39                 determination = None, 
  40                 refinement = None,
  41                 in_file = None,
  42                 out_file = None,
  43                 heq = False, 
  44                 icut = None,
  45                 cmap = 'gray',
  46                 csquare=50,
  47                 cintensity=0.8,
  48                 messages = False,
  49                 print_sums = False,
  50                 final_replot=False):
  51        '''
  52        CenterLocator object
  53        = determination + refinement of diffractogram center.
  54
  55        Parameters
  56        ----------
  57        input_image : str or path or numpy.array
  58            Input image = 2D-diffration pattern.
  59        determination : TYPE, optional
  60            Method of center determination.
  61        refinement : TYPE, optional
  62            Method of center refinement.
  63        in_file : TYPE, optional
  64            Name of the text file,
  65            to which we can save the center coordinates.
  66        out_file : TYPE, optional
  67            Name of the the text file,
  68            from which we can read the center coordinates.
  69        heq : TYPE, optional
  70            DESCRIPTION. The default is False.
  71        icut : TYPE, optional
  72            DESCRIPTION. The default is None.
  73        cmap : TYPE, optional
  74            DESCRIPTION. The default is 'gray'.
  75        csquare : TYPE, optional
  76            DESCRIPTION. The default is 50.
  77        cintensity : TYPE, optional
  78            DESCRIPTION. The default is 0.8.
  79        messages : TYPE, optional
  80            DESCRIPTION. The default is False.
  81        print_sums : bool, optional, default is False
  82            This parameter is relevant only for 'manual' methods
  83            of center *determination* and *refinement*.
  84            If it is *True*,
  85            then sum of intensity for refined circle
  86            is printed to stdout is printed and updated after each movement.
  87        final_replot : TYPE, optional
  88            DESCRIPTION. The default is False.
  89
  90        Returns
  91        -------
  92        None.
  93
  94        '''
  95        
  96        # (0) Initialize basic parameters
  97        # TODO - more-or-less copy+paste from previous
  98        
  99        # (1) Initialize/run CenterDetermination
 100        self.center1 = CenterDetermination(
 101            self.image_name,
 102            self.determination,
 103            self.heq,
 104            self.icut,
 105            self.cmap,
 106            self.csquare,
 107            self.cintensity,
 108            self.messages,
 109            self.print_sums,
 110            self.final_replot)
 111            
 112        # (2) Initialize/run CenterRefinement
 113        self.center2 = CenterRefinement(
 114            self.input_image, 
 115            self.refinement,
 116            self.in_file,
 117            self.out_file,
 118            self.heq, 
 119            self.icut,
 120            self.cmap,
 121            self.messages,
 122            self.print_sums,
 123            self.final_replot)
 124
 125        # (3) Collect results
 126        self.x1 = self.center1.x
 127        self.y1 = self.center1.y
 128        self.x2 = self.center2.x
 129        self.y2 = self.center2.y 
 130
 131        # (4) Return the results
 132        return(self.x1,self.y1,self.x2,self.y2)

 169class CenterEstimator:
 170    '''
 171    Detection of the center of diffraction patterns.
 172    
 173    The center can be estimated in one of the following ways:
 174    
 175    * Center of the intensity/mass in selected area.
 176    * Center from three points (defined interactivelly)
 177      which define one ring in a powder electron diffraction pattern.
 178    * Center estimated from Hough transform,
 179      which detects circles in the diffraction pattern.
 180    
 181    SUBCLASS : CenterLocator
 182    
 183    * the subclass refines the position of the estimated center 
 184        
 185    Parameters
 186    ----------
 187    image_path : string
 188        direct path to an image with diffraction patterns
 189    detection_method : string
 190        Selection of a method for center calculation. String codes are:
 191            - 'manual' : manual detection via 3 points
 192            - 'intensity' : detection via maximum intensity
 193            - 'hough' : automatic detection via Hough transform
 194    correction_method : string
 195       Selection of a method for center position correction. Default is None.
 196       String codes are:
 197           - 'manual' : manual corection 
 198           - 'variance' : correction via variance minimization 
 199           - 'sum' : correction via sum maximization
 200    heq : boolean, optional, default is False
 201        Allow histogram equalization.
 202        The equalization is virtual, the original image is unchanged.
 203    icut : integer, optional, default is None
 204        Intensity cut to enhance image contrast.
 205        Example: icut=300, all pixels intensities >300 are set to 300.
 206    cmap : str, optional, default is 'gray'
 207        Name of matplotlib colormap.
 208        Any valid colormap ('viridis','magma') can be used.
 209    messages : bool, optional, default is False
 210        Print to terminal additional messages about program run.
 211    
 212    Returns
 213    -------
 214    self.x : float
 215        x-coordinate of the detected center
 216    self.y : float
 217        y-coordinate of the detected center
 218    self.r : float
 219        radius of the detected center (if available, othervise returns None)        
 220    '''
 221    
 222    def __init__(self, input_image, 
 223                       detection_method = None, 
 224                       correction_method = None,
 225                       heq = False, 
 226                       icut = None,
 227                       cmap = 'gray',
 228                       csquare=50,
 229                       cintensity=0.8,
 230                       messages = False):
 231        
 232        # Initialize attributes
 233        self.input_image = input_image
 234        
 235        # Allow input images (np.ndarray) and image path
 236        if isinstance(input_image, np.ndarray):
 237            self.image = input_image
 238        else:
 239            self.image = ediff.io.read_image(self.input_image)
 240            
 241        self.correction_method = correction_method
 242        self.heq = heq
 243        self.icut = icut
 244        self.to_refine = []
 245        self.cmap = cmap
 246        self.messages = messages
 247        
 248        # Initialize the marker size and zoom level
 249        self.marker_size = 100  # Adjust this initial value as desired
 250        
 251        # Run functions
 252        self.preprocess_images(preInit = 1)
 253
 254        # Determine detection method
 255        if detection_method == 'manual':
 256            self.x, self.y, self.r = self.detection_3points()
 257            
 258        elif detection_method == 'intensity':
 259            self.x, self.y, self.r = self.detection_intensity(csquare, cintensity)
 260
 261        elif detection_method == 'hough':
 262            self.x, self.y, self.r = self.detection_Hough()  
 263        else:
 264            print("Incorrect method for detection selected")
 265            sys.exit()
 266
 267            
 268    def detection_intensity(self, csquare, cintensity, plot_results=0):
 269        '''
 270        Find center of intensity/mass of an array.
 271        
 272        Parameters
 273        ----------
 274        arr : 2D-numpy array
 275            The array, whose intensity center will be determined.
 276        csquare : int, optional, default is 20
 277            The size/edge of the square in the (geometrical) center.
 278            The intensity center will be searched only within the central square.
 279            Reasons: To avoid other spots/diffractions and
 280            to minimize the effect of possible intensity assymetry around center. 
 281        cintensity : float, optional, default is 0.8
 282            The intensity fraction.
 283            When searching the intensity center, we will consider only
 284            pixels with intensity > max.intensity.
 285            
 286        Returns
 287        -------
 288        xc,yc : float,float
 289            XY-coordinates of the intensity/mass center of the array.
 290            Round XY-coordinates if you use them for image/array calculations.
 291        '''  
 292        
 293        # (1) Get image/array size
 294        image = np.copy(self.to_refine)
 295        arr = np.copy(image)
 296        xsize,ysize = arr.shape
 297        
 298        # (2) Calculate borders around the central square
 299        xborder = (xsize - csquare) // 2
 300        yborder = (ysize - csquare) // 2
 301        
 302        # (3) Create the central square,
 303        # from which the intensity center will be detected
 304        arr2 = arr[xborder:-xborder,yborder:-yborder].copy()
 305        
 306        # (4) In the central square,
 307        # set all values below cintenstity to zero
 308        arr2 = np.where(arr2>np.max(arr2)*cintensity, arr2, 0)
 309        
 310        # (5) Determine the intensity center from image moments
 311        # see image moments in...
 312        # skimage: https://scikit-image.org/docs/dev/api/skimage.measure.html
 313        # wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image_moment -> Centroid
 314        # ---
 315        # (a) Calculate 1st central moments of the image
 316        M = moments(arr2,1)
 317        # (b) Calculate the intensity center = centroid according to www-help
 318        (self.x, self.y) = (M[1,0]/M[0,0], M[0,1]/M[0,0])
 319        # (c) We have centroid of the central square
 320        # but we have to recalculate it to the whole image
 321        (self.x, self.y) = (self.x + xborder, self.y + yborder)
 322        # (d) Radius of a diffraction ring is hardcoded to 100 here
 323        # TODO: consider improving/correcting/removing in the future
 324        self.r = 100
 325        
 326        # (6) User information (if required)
 327        if self.messages:
 328            print("--- IntensityCenter = center of intensity/mass ---")
 329            print(f"Center coordinates [x, y]: [{self.x:.3f}, {self.y:.3f}]")
 330            print("---")
 331
 332        # (7) Plot results (if required)
 333        if plot_results == 1:
 334           self.visualize_center(self.x, self.y, self.r) 
 335                
 336        # (8) Return the results:
 337        # a) XY-coordinates of the center
 338        # b) radius of the circle/diff.ring,
 339        #    from which the center was determined
 340        # ! radius of the circle is just hardcoded here - see TODO note above
 341        return(self.x, self.y, self.r)
 342
 343            
 344    def detection_3points(self, plot_results=1):
 345        '''         
 346        In the input image, select manually 3 points defining a circle using
 347        a key press event 
 348            - press '1' to select a point
 349                
 350        If the user is not satisfied with the point selection, it can be
 351        deleted using a key press event:
 352            - press '2' to delete the most recent
 353            - press '3' to delete the point closest to the cursor
 354        
 355        If the user is satisified with the points selected, the rest 
 356        of the program will be executed 
 357            - press 'd' to proceed >DONE<
 358        
 359        Coordinates of the center and radius will be calculated automatically
 360        using method self.calculate_circle()
 361        
 362        In addition, the user will be able to manually adjust the original
 363        center position by using pre-defined keys.
 364        
 365        Parameters
 366        ----------
 367        plot_results : int, binary
 368            Plot the pattern determined by pixels selected by the user.
 369            Default is 1. To cancel visualization, set plot_results = 0.
 370        
 371        Returns
 372        -------
 373        self.x : float64
 374            x-coordinate of the detected center
 375        self.y : float64
 376            y-coordinate of the detected center
 377        self.r : float64
 378            radius of the detected center
 379            (if available, othervise returns None)
 380                                    
 381        '''
 382        
 383        # Load image
 384        im = self.to_refine
 385    
 386        # Create a figure and display the image
 387        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 12))
 388        
 389        # Allow using arrows to move back and forth between view ports
 390        plt.rcParams['keymap.back'].append('left')
 391        plt.rcParams['keymap.forward'].append('right')
 392 
 393        plt.title("Select 3 points defining one of diffraction circles", 
 394                  fontsize = 20)
 395        ax.imshow(im, cmap = self.cmap)
 396        ax.axis('off')
 397
 398        # User information:
 399        if self.messages:
 400            print("--- ThreePoints = semi-automated center detection ---")
 401            print()
 402            print("Select 3 points to define a circle in the diffractogram:")
 403            print("Use these keys for the selection:")
 404            print("  - '1' : define a point at current cursor position")
 405            print("  - '2' : delete the last point")
 406            print("  - '3' : delete the point closest to the cursor")
 407            print("  - 'd' : done = finished = go to the next step")
 408            print()
 409            print("Close the figure to terminate. No center will be detected.")
 410            print("---")
 411       
 412        # Enable interactive mode
 413        # (figure is updated after every plotting command
 414        # (so that calling figure.show() is not necessary
 415        plt.ion()
 416 
 417        # Initialize the list of coordinates
 418        self.coords = [] 
 419        
 420        # Initialize all flags and counters
 421        calculate_circle_flag = False          # press 'd' event
 422        termination_flag = False               # close window event
 423        point_counter = 0                      # number of selected points
 424        
 425        ### Define the event handler for figure close event
 426        def onclose(event):
 427            nonlocal termination_flag
 428            termination_flag = True
 429            if self.messages:
 430                print('Execution terminated.')
 431 
 432        # Connect the event handler to the figure close event
 433        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('close_event', onclose)
 434        
 435        
 436        ### Define the callback function for key press events
 437        def onkeypress(event):
 438            # nonlocal to modify the flag variable in the outer scope
 439            nonlocal calculate_circle_flag, point_counter, termination_flag
 440            
 441            # Store the zoom level
 442            current_xlim = ax.get_xlim()
 443            current_ylim = ax.get_ylim()
 444 
 445            ## Delete points -- the closest to the cursor
 446            if event.key == '3':
 447                point_counter -= 1
 448                if len(self.coords) > 0:
 449                    pointer_x, pointer_y = event.xdata, event.ydata
 450                    distances = [
 451                        np.sqrt((x - pointer_x)**2 + (y - pointer_y)**2)
 452                        for x, y in self.coords]
 453                    closest_index = np.argmin(distances)
 454                    del self.coords[closest_index]
 455    
 456                    ## Redraw the image without the deleted point
 457                    ax.clear()
 458                    ax.imshow(self.to_refine, cmap = self.cmap)
 459                    for x, y in self.coords:
 460                        ax.scatter(x, y, 
 461                                   c='r', marker='x', 
 462                                   s=self.marker_size)
 463
 464                    my_plot_title = (
 465                        "Select 3 points to define "
 466                        "one of diffraction circles.")
 467                    plt.title(my_plot_title, fontsize=20)
 468                    
 469                    # Retore the previous zoom level
 470                    ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
 471                    ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
 472                    ax.axis('off')
 473                    
 474                    fig.canvas.draw()
 475                else:
 476                    print("No points to delete.")
 477    
 478            # Delete recent point (last added) -- independent on the cursor
 479            if event.key == '2':
 480                # Check if there are points to delete
 481                if point_counter > 0:  
 482                    point_counter -= 1
 483                    if len(self.coords) > 0:
 484                        # Delete the last point in the list
 485                        del self.coords[-1]
 486                        if self.messages:
 487                            print('The most recently selected point deleted.')
 488                            print('Please select a new one.')
 489    
 490                        # Redraw the image without the deleted point
 491                        ax.clear()
 492                        ax.imshow(self.to_refine, cmap = self.cmap)
 493                        for x, y in self.coords:
 494                            ax.scatter(x, y,
 495                                       c='r', marker='x', 
 496                                       s=self.marker_size)
 497
 498                        my_plot_title = (
 499                            "Select 3 points to define "
 500                            "one of diffraction circles.")
 501                        plt.title(my_plot_title)
 502                        
 503                        # Retore the previous zoom level
 504                        ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
 505                        ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
 506                        ax.axis('off')
 507
 508                        fig.canvas.draw()
 509                else:
 510                    print("No points to delete.")
 511                    
 512            ## Select points 
 513            elif event.key == '1':
 514                # Only allow selecting up to three points
 515                if point_counter < 3:  
 516                    # Save the coordinates of the clicked point
 517                    new_point = (event.xdata, event.ydata)
 518                    
 519                    if new_point in self.coords:
 520                        # Do not allow multiple selection of one point
 521                        print("The selected point already exists.")
 522                    else:
 523                        # Add selected point
 524                        self.coords.append(new_point)
 525    
 526                        # Visualize the selected point on the image
 527                        ax.scatter(event.xdata, event.ydata, 
 528                                   c='r', marker='x', 
 529                                   s=self.marker_size)
 530
 531                        # Restore the previous zoom level
 532                        ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
 533                        ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
 534                        ax.axis('off')
 535
 536                        fig.canvas.draw()
 537    
 538                        point_counter += 1
 539                else: # 3 points selected
 540                    print("3 points already selected.")
 541    
 542                if len(self.coords) == 3:
 543                    # Turn off interactive mode
 544                    plt.ioff()
 545    
 546                    if self.messages:
 547                        print("3 points selected.")
 548                        print("Press 'd' to calculate the center position.")
 549    
 550            # Calculate circle or terminate
 551            elif event.key == 'd':
 552                if len(self.coords) == 3:
 553                    calculate_circle_flag = True
 554 
 555                else:
 556                    print("Select exactly 3 points to calculate the circle.")
 557                    fig.canvas.draw()
 558    
 559        # Connect the callback function to the key press event
 560        cid0 = fig.canvas.mpl_connect('key_press_event', onkeypress)
 561
 562        # Show the plot
 563        plt.tight_layout()
 564        ax.axis('off')
 565
 566        plt.show(block=False)
 567      
 568        # Wait for 'd' key event or close the figure if no points are selected
 569        while not calculate_circle_flag and not termination_flag:
 570 
 571            try:
 572                plt.waitforbuttonpress(timeout=0.1)
 573                # Store the zoom level
 574                current_xlim = ax.get_xlim()
 575                current_ylim = ax.get_ylim()
 576 
 577                # Plot detected diffraction pattern
 578                if calculate_circle_flag:
 579 
 580                    self.calculate_circle(plot_results=0)
 581                    
 582                    ax.clear()
 583                    ax.imshow(self.to_refine, cmap = self.cmap)
 584                    # Retore the previous zoom level
 585                    ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
 586                    ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
 587                 
 588                    circle = plt.Circle(
 589                        (self.x, self.y), self.r, color='r', fill=False)
 590                    ax.add_artist(circle)
 591        
 592                    # Plot center point
 593                    center, = ax.plot(self.x, self.y, 'rx', markersize=12)
 594                    plt.title('Manually adjust the position of the center using keys.')
 595        
 596                    # Display the image
 597                    plt.draw()
 598                    ax.axis('off')
 599
 600                    plt.show(block = False)
 601
 602            except KeyboardInterrupt:
 603                print("Execution manually interrupted by user.")
 604                break
 605            except ValueError as e:
 606                print("ValueError:", e)
 607                break
 608           
 609        # If the termination_flag is True, stop the code
 610        if termination_flag: 
 611             print("No points selected. Returned None values.")
 612             sys.exit()
 613             return None, None, None
 614        
 615        # Disconnect key press events
 616        fig.canvas.mpl_disconnect(cid0) 
 617        
 618        # local variables save
 619        self.center = center
 620        
 621        self.backip = [self.x, self.y, self.r]
 622        # Manually adjust the calculated center coordinates
 623        self.x, self.y, self.r = self.adjustment_3points(fig, circle, center)
 624
 625        # Return the results:
 626        # a) XY-coordinates of the center
 627        # b) radius of the circle/diff.ring,
 628        #    from which the center was determined
 629        return(self.x, self.y, self.r)
 630
 631    
 632    def adjustment_3points(self, fig, circle, center, plot_results=0):
 633        '''
 634        Adjustment of the center position calculated from 3 points.
 635        Interactive refinement using keys:
 636
 637        The user can change the position of the center of the diffraction
 638        pattern and also the radius of the detected pattern using keys:
 639            - left / right / top / down arrows : move left / right / top / down
 640            - '+' : increase radius
 641            - '-' : decrease radius
 642            - 'd' : done, termination of the refinement
 643
 644        If the interactive figure is closed without any modifications,
 645        the function returns input variables and the proccess terminates.
 646        
 647        Parameters
 648        ----------
 649        fig : figure.Figure object
 650            interactive figure in which a diffraction pattern has been
 651            manually detected.
 652        circle : patches.Circle object
 653            circle defined via 3 points manually delected
 654        center : tuple
 655            calculated center of the input circle.
 656        plot_results : boolean
 657            visualize results. The default is 1 (plot detected center).
 658
 659        Returns
 660        -------
 661        xy : tuple
 662            x,y-coordinates of the center of the diffraction pattern.
 663        r : integer
 664            radius of the diffraction pattern.
 665
 666        '''
 667        # Remove default left / right arrow key press events
 668        plt.rcParams['keymap.back'].remove('left')
 669        plt.rcParams['keymap.forward'].remove('right')
 670        
 671        if self.messages:
 672            print("--- Interactive center refinement ---")
 673            print("Use these keys:")
 674            print("  - 'leftArrow'  : move left")
 675            print("  - 'RightArrow' : move right")
 676            print("  - 'UpArrow'    : move up")
 677            print("  - 'DownArrow'  : move down")
 678            print("  - '+' : increase circle radius")
 679            print("  - '-' : decrease circle radius")
 680            print("  - 'd' : refinement done")
 681            print("Technical note:")
 682            print("  the default shortcuts for LeftArrow and RightArrow")
 683            print("  temporarily overriden, but corresponding icons do work.")
 684        
 685        # Initialize variables and flags
 686        self.backip = np.array((self.x, self.y))
 687        xy = np.array((self.x, self.y))
 688        r = np.copy(self.r)
 689        termination_flag = False
 690        
 691        plt.title("Manually adjust the center position.", fontsize=20)
 692
 693        plt.ion()
 694          
 695        ### Define the event handler for figure close event
 696        def onclose(event):
 697            nonlocal termination_flag
 698            termination_flag = True
 699            if self.messages:
 700                print('Execution terminated.')
 701 
 702        # Connect the event handler to the figure close event
 703        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('close_event', onclose)
 704        
 705        # Define the callback function for key press events
 706        def onkeypress2(event):
 707            # Use nonlocal to modify the center position in the outer scope
 708            nonlocal xy, r, termination_flag
 709
 710            # OTHER KEYS USED IN INTERACTIVE FIGURES
 711            #   event.key == '1': select a point in self.detection_3points()
 712            #   event.key == '2': delete the last point in self.detection...
 713            #   event.key == '3': delete a point in self.detection...
 714            #   event.key == 'd': proceed in self.detection_3points()
 715            
 716            if event.key in ['up', 'down', 'left', 'right', '+', '-']:
 717                if event.key in ['+', '-']:
 718                    r += 1 if event.key == '+' else -1
 719                else:
 720                    # Perform shifts normally
 721                    if event.key == 'up':
 722                        xy[1] -= 0.5
 723                       # print('Moved up')
 724                    elif event.key == 'down':
 725                        xy[1] += 0.5
 726                       # print('Moved down')
 727                    elif event.key == 'left':
 728                        xy[0] -= 0.5
 729                       # print('Moved left')
 730                    elif event.key == 'right':
 731                        xy[0] += 0.5
 732                       # print('Moved right')
 733
 734            # Terminate the interactive refinement with 'd' key
 735            if event.key == 'd':
 736                termination_flag = True
 737                if self.messages:
 738                    print("--- Refinement done. ---")
 739
 740            # Update the plot with the new center position
 741            circle.set_center((xy[0], xy[1]))  # circle
 742            circle.set_radius(r)               # radius
 743            center.set_data([xy[0]], [xy[1]])  # center
 744
 745            plt.title("Manually adjust the center position.", fontsize=20)
 746         
 747            # Update the plot
 748            plt.draw() 
 749        
 750        # Disconnect the on_key_press1 event handler from the figure
 751        fig.canvas.mpl_disconnect(fig.canvas.manager.key_press_handler_id)
 752        
 753        # Connect the callback function to the key press event
 754        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('key_press_event', onkeypress2)
 755
 756        # Enable interaction mode
 757        plt.ion() 
 758               
 759        # Wait for 'd' key press or figure closure
 760        while not termination_flag:
 761            try:
 762                plt.waitforbuttonpress(timeout=0.1)
 763            except KeyboardInterrupt:
 764                # If the user manually closes the figure, terminate the loop
 765                termination_flag = True
 766                
 767        # Turn off interactive mode
 768        plt.ioff()
 769        
 770        # Display the final figure with the selected center position and radius
 771        plt.tight_layout()
 772
 773        plt.show(block=False)
 774        
 775        # If the termination_flag is True, stop the code
 776        if termination_flag: 
 777            plt.close()  # Close the figure
 778
 779        # Print results
 780        if self.messages:
 781            print("CenterEstimator :: manual detection + adjustment")
 782            print(f"Center coordinates: {xy[0]:.2f} {xy[1]:.2f}")
 783        
 784    
 785        return xy[0], xy[1], r
 786    
 787        
 788    def detection_Hough(self, plot_results=0):
 789        '''        
 790        Perform Hough transform to detect center of diffraction patterns.
 791        This is a method to automatically detect circular diffraction patterns
 792        
 793        Parameters
 794        ----------
 795        plot_results : int, binary
 796            Plot the pattern determined by pixels selected by the user.
 797            Default is 1. To cancel visualization, set plot_results = 0.
 798
 799        Returns
 800        -------
 801        self.x : float64
 802            x-coordinate of the detected center
 803        self.y : float64
 804            y-coordinate of the detected center
 805        self.r : float64
 806            radius of the detected center
 807                                    
 808        '''
 809        ## Image preprocessing
 810        im = np.copy(self.to_refine)
 811        
 812        # if the brightness of the image is small enough, pixel values greater
 813        # than 50 will be set to 0 -- removal of the beam stopper influence
 814        
 815        if self.heq == 0:
 816            if sum(sum(im)) < 150000:
 817                    max_indices = np.where(im > 50)
 818        
 819                    row_idx = max_indices[0]
 820                    col_idx = max_indices[1]
 821        
 822                    im[row_idx, col_idx] = 0    
 823                
 824            # Detect edges using the Canny edge detector
 825            edges = sk.feature.canny(im, 
 826                                     sigma=0.2, 
 827                                     low_threshold=80, 
 828                                     high_threshold=100)
 829        elif self.heq == 1:
 830            if sum(sum(im)) > 40000:
 831                max_indices = np.where(im > 50)
 832
 833                row_idx = max_indices[0]
 834                col_idx = max_indices[1]
 835
 836                im[row_idx, col_idx] = 0    
 837            
 838            # Detect edges using the Canny edge detector
 839            edges = sk.feature.canny(im, 
 840                                     sigma=0.2, 
 841                                     low_threshold=0.80, 
 842                                     high_threshold=1)
 843        
 844        
 845        # Define the radii range for the concentric circles
 846        # (set empirically based on the available pictures)
 847        min_radius = 40
 848        max_radius = 200
 849        radius_step = 10
 850        radii = np.arange(min_radius, max_radius + radius_step, radius_step)
 851
 852        ### Perform the Hough transform to detect circles
 853        # Circle detection involves converting edge pixels into parameter space, 
 854        # where each point represents a possible circle center and radius. 
 855        # The circles are then identified as peaks in the parameter space, 
 856        # enabling accurate detection of circular shapes in the image.
 857        hough_res = hough_circle(edges, radii)
 858
 859        # Extract the circle peaks
 860        _, self.x, self.y, self.r = hough_circle_peaks(hough_res, 
 861                                                            radii, 
 862                                                            total_num_peaks=1)
 863        
 864        
 865        # User information:
 866        if self.messages:
 867            print("------------ Diffraction pattern detection via Hough transform -----------")
 868            print("Central coordinate [ x, y ]: [{:.3f}, {:.3f}]".format(float(self.x), 
 869                                                                         float(self.y)))
 870            print("--------------------------------------------------------------------------")
 871        
 872        
 873        self.x, self.y, self.r = float(self.x[0]), float(self.y[0]), float(self.r[0])
 874
 875        # Return results, convert coordinates to float
 876        return self.x, self.y, self.r
 877
 878   
 879    def calculate_circle(self, plot_results):
 880        ''' 
 881        Calculates coordinates of the center and radius of a circle defined via
 882        3 points determined by the user. Plots the calculated circle, detected 
 883        points and marks the center.
 884        
 885        Parameters
 886        ----------
 887        plot_results : int, binary
 888            Plot the calculated center and circle. To cancel visualization, 
 889            set plot_results = 0.
 890        self.coords : array of float64
 891            Coordinates of 3 manually selected points
 892        
 893        Returns
 894        -------
 895        self.x : float64
 896            x-coordinate of the detected center
 897        self.y : float64
 898            y-coordinate of the detected center
 899        self.r : float64
 900            radius of the detected center
 901                                    
 902        '''
 903        # Extract the coordinates of the points        
 904        x = [self.coords[0][0], self.coords[1][0], self.coords[2][0]]
 905        y = [self.coords[0][1], self.coords[1][1], self.coords[2][1]]
 906        
 907        # Compute the radius and center coordinates of the circle
 908            # a: the squared length of the side between the second 
 909            #    and third points (x[1], y[1]) and (x[2], y[2]).
 910            # b: the squared length of the side between the first 
 911            #    and third points (x[0], y[0]) and (x[2], y[2]).
 912            # c: the squared length of the side between the first 
 913            #    and second points (x[0], y[0]) and (x[1], y[1]).
 914            # s: the twice the signed area of the triangle formed by 3 points
 915            
 916        c = (x[0]-x[1])**2 + (y[0]-y[1])**2
 917        a = (x[1]-x[2])**2 + (y[1]-y[2])**2
 918        b = (x[2]-x[0])**2 + (y[2]-y[0])**2
 919        s = 2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) - (a*a + b*b + c*c) 
 920        
 921        # coordinates of the center
 922        self.x = (a*(b+c-a)*x[0] + b*(c+a-b)*x[1] + c*(a+b-c)*x[2]) / s
 923        self.y = (a*(b+c-a)*y[0] + b*(c+a-b)*y[1] + c*(a+b-c)*y[2]) / s 
 924        
 925        # radius
 926        ar = a**0.5
 927        br = b**0.5
 928        cr = c**0.5 
 929        self.r = ar*br*cr/((ar+br+cr)*(-ar+br+cr)*(ar-br+cr)*(ar+br-cr))**0.5
 930        
 931        # Print results
 932        if self.messages:
 933            print("CenterEstimator :: manual center detection")
 934            print(f"Center coordinates: {self.x:.2f} {self.y:.2f}")
 935                    
 936        if plot_results==1:
 937            # Create and manage the figure
 938            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
 939            manager = plt.get_current_fig_manager()
 940            manager.window.showMaximized()
 941            ax.imshow(self.image, cmap = self.cmap)
 942            
 943            # Plot center and points
 944            center, = plt.plot(self.x, self.y, 
 945                     'rx', 
 946                     label='Center', 
 947                     markersize=12)
 948            plt.scatter(x,y, 
 949                        marker='x', 
 950                        color='palevioletred', 
 951                        label = 'Circle points')
 952            plt.title('Circle found using 3 manually detected points')
 953            
 954            # Circle visualization
 955            circle = plt.Circle((self.x,self.y), 
 956                                self.r, 
 957                                color='palevioletred', 
 958                                fill=False,
 959                                label = 'pattern')
 960            ax.add_artist(circle)
 961            
 962            # Set the aspect ratio to equal to have a circular shape
 963            plt.axis('equal')
 964            
 965            plt.legend(loc='lower center', 
 966                       ncol=2, 
 967                       bbox_to_anchor=(0.5,-0.1), 
 968                       mode='expand', 
 969                       frameon=False)
 970            plt.axis('off')
 971            plt.tight_layout()
 972            plt.show(block=False)
 973
 974        
 975        self.center = (self.x, self.y)
 976        self.circle = plt.Circle((self.x,self.y),self.r)
 977        
 978
 979        return self.x, self.y, self.r, self.center, self.circle
 980

1030    def central_square(self, arr, csquare, xcenter=None, ycenter=None):
1031        ''' 
1032        Return central square from an array
1033        
1034        Parameters
1035        ----------
1036        arr : 2D-numpy array
1037            The original array from which the central_square will be extracted
1038        csquare : int, optional, default is 20
1039            The size/edge of the square in the (geometrical) center.
1040            The intensity center will be searched only within the central square.
1041            Reasons: To avoid other spots/diffractions and
1042            to minimize the effect of possible intensity assymetry around center. 
1043        xcenter : float64
1044            x-coordinate of array center. Deafault is None
1045        ycenter : float64
1046            y-coordinate of array center. Deafault is None
1047
1048        Returns
1049        -------
1050        arr2 : 2D-numpy array
1051            central square extracted from input array
1052        '''
1053        
1054        xsize, ysize = arr.shape
1055        # If center of was not given, take geometrical center
1056        # (for array selections/slicing, we need integers => round, //
1057        xc = round(xcenter) or xsize // 2
1058        yc = round(ycenter) or ysize // 2
1059        
1060        # Half of the central square
1061        # (for array selections/slicing, we need integers => //
1062        half_csquare = csquare // 2
1063        
1064        # Create sub-array = just central square around xc,yc
1065        arr2 = arr[
1066            xc-half_csquare:xc+half_csquare,
1067            yc-half_csquare:yc+half_csquare].copy()
1068        
1069        return(arr2)
1070

1073class CenterLocator(CenterEstimator):
1074    ''' SUBCLASS of CircleEstimator
1075    ----------
1076    
1077    Automatic adjustment of the center position of diffraction patterns,
1078    which was found using methods defined in the class CircleDetection
1079    
1080    
1081    Parameters
1082    ----------
1083    image_path : string
1084        direct path to an image with diffraction patterns
1085    detection_method : string
1086        Selection of a method for center calculation. String codes are:
1087            - 'manual' : manual detection via 3 points
1088            - 'intensity' : detection via maximum intensity
1089            - 'hough' : automatic detection via Hough transform
1090    correction_method : string
1091       Selection of a method for center position correction. Default is None.
1092       String codes are:
1093           - 'manual' : manual corection 
1094           - 'var' : correction via variance minimization 
1095           - 'sum' : correction via sum maximization
1096    heq : boolean
1097        Allow histogram equalization. The default is 0 (no enhancement)
1098    icut : boolean
1099        Allow image enhancement. The default is 0 (no enhancement)
1100
1101
1102    Returns
1103    -------
1104    self.xx : int32
1105        adjusted x-coordinate of the detected center
1106    self.yy : int32
1107        adjusted y-coordinate of the detected center
1108    self.rr : int32
1109        radius of the detected center
1110    '''
1111    
1112
1113    def __init__(self, image_path,
1114                 detection_method, correction_method=None, 
1115                 heq=False, icut=None, cmap='gray',
1116                 messages=False, final_replot=False):
1117        
1118        # (1) Call the constructor of the base class to initialize its methods
1119        super().__init__(image_path,
1120            detection_method, correction_method,
1121            heq=heq, icut=icut, cmap=cmap, messages=messages)
1122        
1123
1124        # (2) Define additional parameter
1125        self.messages = messages
1126        self.image_path = image_path
1127
1128
1129        # (3) Run correction method and get refined parameters
1130        if correction_method is not None:
1131            self.ret = 1
1132            if correction_method == 'manual':
1133                if detection_method == 'manual':
1134                    self.yy, self.xx, self.rr = self.x, self.y, self.r
1135                    self.y, self.x, self.r = self.backip[0], self.backip[1], self.r
1136                elif detection_method == 'intensity':
1137                    self.yy, self.xx, self.rr = \
1138                        self.ref_interactive(self.y, self.x, self.r)
1139                else:
1140                    self.yy, self.xx, self.rr = \
1141                        self.ref_interactive(self.x, self.y, self.r)
1142                        
1143            elif correction_method == 'var':
1144                self.xx, self.yy, self.rr = \
1145                    self.ref_var(self.x, self.y, self.r)
1146                if detection_method == 'manual':
1147                    self.xx, self.yy = self.yy, self.xx
1148                    self.x, self.y = self.y, self.x
1149                    
1150            elif correction_method == 'sum':
1151                self.xx, self.yy, self.rr = \
1152                    self.ref_sum(self.x, self.y, self.r)
1153                if detection_method == 'manual':
1154                    self.xx, self.yy = self.yy, self.xx
1155                    self.x, self.y = self.y, self.x
1156
1157            else:
1158                print("Incorrect method for correction selected")
1159                sys.exit()
1160            
1161            if detection_method == 'hough':
1162                self.x, self.y = self.y, self.x
1163                self.xx, self.yy = self.yy, self.xx
1164
1165            if final_replot:
1166                self.visualize_refinement(
1167                    self.y, self.x, self.r, 
1168                    (self.yy, self.xx), self.rr)
1169        else:
1170            self.ret = 2
1171
1172
1173    def preprocess_images(self, preInit=0, preHough=0, preManual=0, preVar = 0, 
1174                          preSum = 0, preInt=0):
1175        """
1176        FOR AUTOMATIC METHODS OPTIMIZATION AND MORE UNIVERSAL SOLUTIONS
1177        >>> to be finished later, as it is not the most important thing now
1178            
1179        Function for input image preprocessing based on the methods 
1180        defined in the class initialization - self.detection_method, 
1181        self.correction_method.
1182
1183        Parameters
1184        ----------
1185        preInit : bool, optional
1186            Perform preprocessing of the input image (when using icut or heq). 
1187            This is called automatically every time, if no preprocessing
1188            specified, the detection and refinement will be performed on 
1189            original image. The default is 0.
1190        preHough : bool, optional
1191            Perform preprocessing for automatic detection via Hough transform. 
1192            
1193
1194        Returns
1195        -------
1196        manu : NumPy array
1197            Pre-processed image for the manual detection method
1198        edges : array of bool
1199            Detected edges via Canny detector for automatic Hough transform
1200        """
1201        
1202        # Flags
1203        control_print = 1
1204        
1205        # Load original image
1206        image = np.copy(self.image)
1207        
1208        ### After initialization: perform an image enhancement if specified
1209        if preInit == 1:
1210            # Enhance diffraction pattern to make it more visible
1211            if self.heq == 1:
1212                if self.messages:
1213                    print("Histogram equalized.")
1214                image = sk.exposure.equalize_adapthist(image)
1215                # plt.figure()
1216                # plt.imshow(image)
1217                # plt.show(block=False)
1218                
1219            # Edit contrast with a user-predefined parameter
1220            if self.icut is not None:
1221                if self.messages:
1222                    print("Contrast enhanced.")
1223                image = np.where(image > self.icut, self.icut, image)
1224                
1225
1226            self.to_refine = image
1227            return
1228        
1229        #######################################################################
1230        # Hough transform: perform pre-processing necessary for the detection
1231        if preHough == 1:
1232           # self.imHough = np.copy(self.to_refine)
1233           
1234            if self.heq == 0:
1235                csq = self.central_square(self.to_refine, csquare=80)   
1236                
1237                # Beam stopper present in image
1238                if np.median(csq)<100 and np.median(csq) > 0:
1239                    if self.messages:
1240                        print('Beamstopper removed.')
1241                    max_indices = np.where(self.to_refine > np.median(csq))
1242        
1243                    row_idx = max_indices[0]
1244                    col_idx = max_indices[1]
1245        
1246                    self.to_refine[row_idx, col_idx] = 0    
1247                    
1248                    max_indices = np.where(self.to_refine < 0.8*np.median(csq))
1249                    row_idx = max_indices[0]
1250                    col_idx = max_indices[1]
1251        
1252                    self.to_refine[row_idx, col_idx] = 0   
1253                    
1254                    # Detect edges using the Canny edge detector
1255                    edges = sk.feature.canny(self.to_refine, 
1256                                              sigma=0.2, 
1257                                              low_threshold=2.5*np.median(self.to_refine), 
1258                                              high_threshold=3*np.median(self.to_refine))
1259                    
1260                    # Dilate the edges to connect them
1261                    selem = sk.morphology.disk(5)
1262                    dilated_edges = sk.morphology.dilation(edges, selem)
1263                    
1264                    # Erode the dilated edges to reduce thickness and smooth the contour
1265                    connected_edges = sk.morphology.erosion(dilated_edges, selem)
1266
1267                    if control_print == 1:
1268                        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, ncols=2)
1269                        ax[0,0].imshow(self.image)
1270                        ax[0,0].set_title("Original image")
1271                        ax[0,1].imshow(self.to_refine)
1272                        ax[0,1].set_title("Hough pre-processed")
1273                        ax[1,0].imshow(edges)
1274                        ax[1,0].set_title("Edges")
1275                        ax[1,1].imshow(connected_edges)
1276                        ax[1,1].set_title("Connected edges")
1277                        plt.tight_layout()
1278                        plt.show(block=False)
1279                        
1280                # No beam stopper in image
1281                else:
1282                    # Detect edges using the Canny edge detector
1283                    print('No beamstopper.')
1284                    edges = sk.feature.canny(self.to_refine, 
1285                                             sigma=0.2, 
1286                                             low_threshold=80, 
1287                                             high_threshold=100)
1288                    
1289                    # Dilate the edges to connect them
1290                    selem = sk.morphology.disk(10)
1291                    dilated_edges = sk.morphology.dilation(edges, selem)
1292                    
1293                    # # Erode the dilated edges to reduce thickness and smooth the contour
1294                    connected_edges = sk.morphology.erosion(dilated_edges, selem)
1295                    connected_edges = sk.morphology.remove_small_objects(connected_edges, 
1296                                                                         min_size=100)
1297                    
1298                    if control_print == 1:
1299                        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, ncols=2)
1300                        ax[0,0].imshow(self.image)
1301                        ax[0,0].set_title("Original image")
1302                        ax[0,1].imshow(self.to_refine)
1303                        ax[0,1].set_title("Hough pre-processed")
1304                        ax[1,0].imshow(edges)
1305                        ax[1,0].set_title("Edges")
1306                        ax[1,1].imshow(connected_edges)
1307                        ax[1,1].set_title("Connected edges")
1308                        plt.tight_layout()
1309                        plt.show(block=False)
1310                
1311            elif self.heq == 1: 
1312                # Central square extraction
1313                csq = self.central_square(self.to_refine, csquare=80)   
1314
1315                # Beam stopper present in image
1316                if 0.4 <= np.median(csq) <= 0.6:
1317                    
1318                    max_indices = np.where(self.to_refine > 2*np.median(self.to_refine))
1319    
1320                    row_idx = max_indices[0]
1321                    col_idx = max_indices[1]
1322    
1323                    self.to_refine[row_idx, col_idx] = 0 
1324                                                     
1325                    # Detect edges using the Canny edge detector
1326                    edges = sk.feature.canny(self.to_refine, 
1327                                              sigma=0.2, 
1328                                              low_threshold=1.5*np.median(self.to_refine), 
1329                                              high_threshold=3*np.median(self.to_refine))
1330
1331                    
1332                    # Erode the dilated edges to reduce thickness and smooth the contour
1333                    #  connected_edges = sk.morphology.erosion(dilated_edges, selem)
1334                    
1335                    if control_print == 1:
1336                        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, ncols=2)
1337                        ax[0,0].imshow(self.image)
1338                        ax[0,0].set_title("Original image")
1339                        ax[0,1].imshow(self.to_refine)
1340                        ax[0,1].set_title("Hough pre-processed")
1341                        ax[1,0].imshow(edges)
1342                        ax[1,0].set_title("Edges")
1343                      #  ax[1,1].imshow(connected_edges)
1344                        ax[1,1].set_title("Connected edges")
1345                        plt.tight_layout()
1346                        plt.show(block=False)
1347                    
1348                # No beam stopper in image
1349                else:
1350                    # Detect edges using the Canny edge detector
1351                    edges = sk.feature.canny(self.to_refine, 
1352                                              sigma=0.2, 
1353                                              low_threshold=2.5*np.median(self.to_refine), 
1354                                              high_threshold=3*np.median(self.to_refine))
1355
1356                   # connected_edges = sk.morphology.erosion(dilated_edges, selem)
1357                    
1358                    if control_print == 1:
1359                        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, ncols=2)
1360                        ax[0,0].imshow(self.image)
1361                        ax[0,0].set_title("Original image")
1362                        ax[0,1].imshow(self.to_refine)
1363                        ax[0,1].set_title("Hough pre-processed")
1364                        ax[1,0].imshow(edges)
1365                        ax[1,0].set_title("Edges")
1366                     #   ax[1,1].imshow(connected_edges)
1367                        ax[1,1].set_title("Connected edges")
1368                        plt.tight_layout()
1369                        plt.show(block=False)
1370            
1371            return edges
1372        
1373                    
1374    def output(self):
1375        """
1376        Manage variables that should be send as the output of the center 
1377        detection. 
1378        
1379        If there were set parameters detection_method and 
1380        correction method during the class initialization, the output will be
1381        coordinates x, y of the center detected by the detection_method and 
1382        coordinates x, y of refined center position by the correction method.
1383        
1384        If there was not set the correction_method parameter, the function
1385        outputs x, y coordinates of the detected center and None, None for
1386        the refined coordinates.
1387
1388        Returns
1389        -------
1390        x : float
1391            x-coordinate of the center detected via detection_method
1392        y : float
1393            y-coordinate of the center detected via detection_method
1394        xx : float
1395            x-coordinate of the center detected via refinement_method
1396        yy : float
1397            y-coordinate of the center detected via refinement_method
1398        """
1399        
1400        if self.ret == 1:
1401            # Convert to float
1402            if type(self.x) != float:
1403                self.x, self.y, self.xx, self.yy, self.r, self.rr = \
1404                    [float(value) for value in (self.x, self.y, 
1405                                                self.xx, self.yy, 
1406                                                self.r, self.rr)]
1407            
1408            # Round radius
1409            self.r, self.rr = np.round(self.r), np.round(self.rr)
1410            
1411            # Return values of center coordinates
1412            return (np.round(self.x,1), np.round(self.y,1), 
1413                    np.round(self.xx,1), np.round(self.yy,1))  
1414        else:
1415            # Convert to float
1416            if type(self.x) != float:
1417                self.x, self.y, self.r = \
1418                    [float(value) for value in (self.x, self.y, self.r)]
1419
1420            # Return values of center coordinates
1421            return (np.round(self.x,1), np.round(self.y,1), None, None)
1422
