1424    def ref_interactive(self, px, py, pr):
1425        ''' 
1426        Manual refinement of the detected diffraction pattern via one of 
1427        the methods provided in the class CircleDetection.
1428        
1429        The user can change the position of the center of the diffraction
1430        pattern and also the radius of the detected pattern using keys:
1431            - left / right / top / down arrows : move left / right / top / down
1432            - '+' : increase radius
1433            - '-' : decrease radius
1434            - 'd' : done, termination of the refinement
1435
1436        If the interactive figure is closed without any modifications,
1437        the function returns input variables and the proccess terminates.
1438        
1439        The results are shown in a figure when the refinement is successful.
1440
1441        Parameters
1442        ----------
1443        px : float64
1444            x-coordinate of the center
1445        py : float64
1446            y-coordinate of the center
1447        pr : float64
1448            radius of the circular diffraction pattern
1449
1450        Returns
1451        -------
1452        x : float64
1453            new x-coordinate of the center
1454        y : float64
1455            new y-coordinate of the center
1456        r : float64
1457            new radius of the circular diffraction pattern
1458        '''
1459        
1460        # Load original image
1461        im = np.copy(self.to_refine)
1462        
1463        # Initialize variables and flags
1464        xy = np.array((px, py))
1465        r = np.copy(pr)
1466        termination_flag = False
1467
1468        # User information:
1469        if self.messages:
1470            print(" ")
1471            print("--------------------------------------------------------------------------")
1472            print("Interactive refinement. Use these keys:")
1473            print("      - 'left arrow' : move left")
1474            print("      - 'right arrow' : move right")
1475            print("      - 'top arrow' : move up")
1476            print("      - 'bottom arrow' : move down")
1477            print("      - '+' : increase circle radius")
1478            print("      - '-' : decrease circle radius")
1479            print("      - 'd' : refinement done")
1480            print("DISCLAIMER: for the purpose of the center shift, the default shortcuts ")
1481            print("for left and right arrows were removed.")
1482            print("--------------------------------------------------------------------------")
1483        
1484        # Create a figure and display the image
1485        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 12))
1486        
1487        # Allow using arrows to move back and forth between view ports
1488        plt.rcParams['keymap.back'].append('left')
1489        plt.rcParams['keymap.forward'].append('right')
1490        
1491        circle = plt.Circle(
1492            (px, py), pr, color='r', fill=False)
1493        ax.add_artist(circle)
1494
1495        # Plot center point
1496        center, = ax.plot(px, py, 'rx', markersize=12)
1497                    
1498
1499        plt.title('Manually adjust the center position.', 
1500                  fontsize=20)
1501
1502        ax.imshow(im, cmap = self.cmap)
1503        ax.axis('off')
1504        
1505        # Enable interactive mode
1506        plt.ion()
1507        
1508
1509        # Display the image
1510        # fig.set_size_inches(self.fig_width, self.fig_height)
1511        plt.show(block=False)
1512        
1513        ### Define the event handler for figure close event
1514        def onclose(event):
1515            nonlocal termination_flag
1516            termination_flag = True
1517            if self.messages:
1518                print('Execution terminated.')
1519 
1520        # Connect the event handler to the figure close event
1521        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('close_event', onclose)
1522        
1523        # Define the callback function for key press events
1524        def onkeypress2(event):
1525            # Use nonlocal to modify the center position in the outer scope
1526            nonlocal xy, r, termination_flag
1527
1528            # OTHER KEYS USED IN INTERACTIVE FIGURES
1529            #   event.key == '1': select a point in self.detection_3points()
1530            #   event.key == '2': delete the last point in self.detection...
1531            #   event.key == '3': delete a point in self.detection...
1532            #   event.key == 'd': proceed in self.detection_3points()
1533            
1534            if event.key in ['up', 'down', 'left', 'right', '+', '-']:
1535                if event.key in ['+', '-']:
1536                    r += 1 if event.key == '+' else -1
1537                else:
1538                    # Perform shifts normally
1539                    if event.key == 'up':
1540                        xy[1] -= 0.5
1541                       # print('Moved up')
1542                    elif event.key == 'down':
1543                        xy[1] += 0.5
1544                       # print('Moved down')
1545                    elif event.key == 'left':
1546                        xy[0] -= 0.5
1547                       # print('Moved left')
1548                    elif event.key == 'right':
1549                        xy[0] += 0.5
1550                       # print('Moved right')
1551
1552            # Terminate the interactive refinement with 'd' key
1553            if event.key == 'd':
1554                termination_flag = True
1555                if self.messages:
1556                    print("--- Refinement done. ---")
1557
1558            # Update the plot with the new center position
1559            circle.set_center((xy[0], xy[1]))  # circle
1560            circle.set_radius(r)               # radius
1561            center.set_data([xy[0]], [xy[1]])  # center
1562
1563            plt.title("Manually adjust the center position.", fontsize=20)
1564         
1565            # Update the plot
1566            plt.draw() 
1567        
1568        # Disconnect the on_key_press1 event handler from the figure
1569        fig.canvas.mpl_disconnect(fig.canvas.manager.key_press_handler_id)
1570        
1571        # Connect the callback function to the key press event
1572        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('key_press_event', onkeypress2)
1573
1574        # Enable interaction mode
1575        plt.ion() 
1576               
1577        # Wait for 'd' key press or figure closure
1578        while not termination_flag:
1579            try:
1580                plt.waitforbuttonpress(timeout=0.1)
1581            except KeyboardInterrupt:
1582                # If the user manually closes the figure, terminate the loop
1583                termination_flag = True
1584         
1585        # Turn off interactive mode
1586        plt.ioff()
1587        
1588        # Display the final figure with the selected center position and radius
1589        plt.tight_layout()
1590
1591        plt.show(block=False)
1592        
1593        # If the termination_flag is True, stop the code
1594        if termination_flag: 
1595            plt.close()  # Close the figure
1596
1597        # Print results
1598        if self.messages:
1599            print("CenterEstimator :: manual detection + adjustment")
1600            print(f"Center coordinates: {xy[0]:.2f} {xy[1]:.2f}")
1601                       
1602        return xy[0], xy[1], r
1603
1604        
1605    def ref_var(self, px, py, pr, plot_results = 0):
1606        '''         
1607        Adjust center coordinates of a detected circular diffraction pattern.
1608        The center adjustment is based on variance minimization.
1609        
1610        The 8-neighbourhood pixels (x) of the current center (o) 
1611        will be tested regarding the minimization:
1612    
1613        - x x x : (px - dx, py + dy) (px, py + dy) ( px + dx, py + dy)
1614    
1615        - x o x : (px - dx, py)      (px, py)      (px + dx, py)
1616    
1617        - x x x : (px - dx, py - dy) (px, py - dy) (px + dx, py - dy)
1618        
1619
1620        Parameters
1621        ----------
1622        self.image : array of uint8
1623            Input image in which the diffraction pattern is to be found
1624        px : float64
1625            x-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted
1626        py : float64
1627            y-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted
1628        pr : float64
1629            radius of the detected center
1630        plot_results : integer (default = 1)
1631            Plot Detected center. The default is 1.
1632        
1633        Returns
1634        -------
1635        px : array of int32
1636           corrected x-coordinates of pixels from circle border
1637        py : array of int32
1638            corrected y-coordinates of pixels from circle border
1639        pr : array of int32
1640            radius of the detected center
1641            
1642        '''
1643        
1644        # Store input for plot
1645        bckup = [np.copy(px), np.copy(py), np.copy(pr)]
1646        
1647        # Load image
1648        image = np.copy(self.image)
1649
1650        # Starting values to be modified 
1651        init_var = self.intensity_var(image, px, py, pr)
1652        min_intensity_var = self.intensity_var(image, px, py, pr)
1653        best_center = (np.copy(px), np.copy(py))
1654        best_radius = np.copy(pr)
1655    
1656        # Convergence criterion for termination of gradient optimization 
1657        # (1) small positive value that serves as a threshold to determine 
1658        #     when the optimization process has converged
1659        convergence_threshold = 0.1*min_intensity_var
1660        
1661        # (2) maximum number of iterations of optimization
1662        max_iterations = 10
1663        
1664        # (3) keep track of the number of consecutive iterations where there 
1665        #     is no improvement in the objective function beyond 
1666        #     the convergence threshold
1667        no_improvement_count = 0
1668    
1669    
1670        # iterative refinement of the center of a circle while keeping
1671        # the radius constant.
1672        step = 0.3
1673        neighbors = [(float(dx), float(dy))
1674            for dx in np.arange(-1, 1 + step, step)
1675            for dy in np.arange(-1, 1 + step, step)]
1676        
1677        for iteration in range(max_iterations):    
1678            # Refine center while keeping radius constant
1679            curr = self.intensity_var(image, 
1680                                      best_center[0], 
1681                                      best_center[1], 
1682                                      best_radius) 
1683            # Store intensity sums of the current center's neighborhood
1684            curr_intensity_var = []
1685            for dx, dy in neighbors:
1686                nx, ny = best_center[0] + dx, best_center[1] + dy
1687                # Check if the point is within the expanded search radius
1688                curr_intensity_var.append(self.intensity_var(image, 
1689                                                             nx, ny, 
1690                                                             best_radius))
1691            
1692            # Find the minimum value coordinates within curr_intensity_var
1693            cx, _ = np.unravel_index(np.argmin(curr_intensity_var),
1694                                     [len(curr_intensity_var),1])
1695                    
1696            # Check for improvement of criterion -- in each iteration just once,
1697            # as the algorithm checks the neighbourhood of the best center (in
1698            # each iteration, the center is updated if possible)
1699            if min(curr_intensity_var) <= min_intensity_var:                           
1700                min_intensity_var = max(curr_intensity_var)
1701                
1702                # Calculate the new best coordinates of the center
1703                n = neighbors[cx]
1704                (nx, ny) = tuple(map(lambda x, y: float(x) + float(y), 
1705                                     best_center, n))
1706                best_center = px, py = (np.copy(nx), np.copy(ny))
1707                
1708            # Update maximum intensity sum 
1709            min_intensity_var = self.intensity_var(image, 
1710                                                    best_center[0], 
1711                                                    best_center[1], 
1712                                                    best_radius) 
1713            
1714            # Refine radius if necessary while keeping the center position 
1715            # constant. It iterates through different radius adjustments to find
1716            # a radius that maximizes the intensity sum of pixels
1717            
1718            radi_intensity_var = []
1719            radii = np.arange(-1, 1 + step, step)
1720            for dr in radii:
1721                new_radius = best_radius + dr
1722                radi_intensity_var.append(self.intensity_var(image, 
1723                                                             best_center[0], 
1724                                                             best_center[1], 
1725                                                             new_radius))
1726                
1727            # Find the minimum value coordinates within curr_var
1728            rx, _ = np.unravel_index(np.argmin(radi_intensity_var),
1729                                      [len(radi_intensity_var),1])
1730            
1731            # Check for improvement of criterion
1732            if max(radi_intensity_var) < min_intensity_var:
1733                min_intensity_var = max(radi_intensity_var)
1734                
1735                n = radii[rx]
1736                nr = best_radius+n
1737                
1738                best_radius = pr = np.copy(nr)
1739
1740            
1741            # Check for convergence and improvement (termination conditions)
1742            impr = abs(min_intensity_var - curr)
1743            if impr < convergence_threshold:
1744                no_improvement_count += 1
1745                if no_improvement_count == 5:
1746                    break
1747        
1748        # Avoid incorrect/redundant refinement
1749        ## (1) swapped coordinates
1750        if ((bckup[0] > bckup[1] and not best_center[0] > best_center[1])
1751            or  (bckup[0] < bckup[1] and not best_center[0] < best_center[1])):
1752            best_center = best_center[::-1]
1753        
1754        ## (2) worsened final maximum intensity sum than the initial one
1755        if np.round(init_var,-2) < np.round(min_intensity_var,-2):
1756            print("Refinement redundant.")
1757            best_center = np.copy(bckup)
1758    
1759        # Print results
1760        if self.messages:
1761            print("CenterLocator: manual detection + adjustment:")
1762            print(f"Estimated center {px:.2f} {py:.2f}")
1763                
1764        return best_center[0], best_center[1], best_radius
1765    
1766    
1767    def ref_sum(self, px, py, pr, plot_results=1):
1768        ''' 
1769        Adjust center position based on gradient optimization method
1770        via maximization of intensity sum.
1771        
1772        The 8-neighbourhood pixels (x) of the current center (o) 
1773        will be tested regarding the maximization:
1774    
1775        - x x x : (px - dx, py + dy) (px, py + dy) ( px + dx, py + dy)
1776    
1777        - x o x : (px - dx, py)      (px, py)      (px + dx, py)
1778    
1779        - x x x : (px - dx, py - dy) (px, py - dy) (px + dx, py - dy)
1780        
1781    
1782        Parameters
1783        ----------
1784        px : float64
1785            x-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted.
1786        py : float64
1787            y-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted.
1788        pr : float64
1789            radius of the detected center.
1790        plot_results : int, optional
1791            Plot Detected center. 
1792            The default is 1.
1793    
1794        Returns  
1795        -------
1796        best_center[0] : float64
1797            Adjusted x-coordinate of the center.
1798        best_center[1] : float64
1799            Adjusted y-coordinate of the center.
1800        best_radius : float64
1801            The adjusted radius of the circular diffraction pattern.
1802        '''
1803        # Store input for plot via self.visualize_refinement()
1804        bckup = [np.copy(px), np.copy(py), np.copy(pr)]
1805
1806        # Image in which the center is refined
1807        image = np.copy(self.image)
1808
1809        # Starting values to be modified 
1810        init_sum = self.intensity_sum(image, px, py, pr)
1811        max_intensity_sum = self.intensity_sum(image, px, py, pr)
1812        best_center = (np.copy(px), np.copy(py))
1813        best_radius = np.copy(pr)
1814        
1815        # Convergence criterion for termination of gradient optimization 
1816        # (1) small positive value that serves as a threshold to determine 
1817        #     when the optimization process has converged
1818        convergence_threshold = 0.05*max_intensity_sum
1819        
1820        # (2) maximum number of iterations of optimization
1821        max_iterations = 50
1822        
1823        # (3) keep track of the number of consecutive iterations where there 
1824        #     is no improvement in the objective function beyond 
1825        #     the convergence threshold
1826        no_improvement_count = 0
1827         
1828        # iterative refinement of the center of a circle while keeping
1829        # the radius constant.
1830        step = 0.2
1831        neighbors = [(float(dx), float(dy))
1832            for dx in np.arange(-1.0, 1.0 + step, step)
1833            for dy in np.arange(-1.0, 1.0 + step, step)]
1834
1835        for iteration in range(max_iterations):    
1836            # Refine center while keeping radius constant
1837            curr = self.intensity_sum(image, 
1838                                      best_center[0], 
1839                                      best_center[1], 
1840                                      best_radius)
1841            
1842            # Store intensity sums of the current center's neighborhood
1843            curr_intensity_sum = []
1844            for dx, dy in neighbors:
1845                nx, ny = best_center[0] + dx, best_center[1] + dy
1846                # Check if the point is within the expanded search radius
1847                curr_intensity_sum.append(self.intensity_sum(image, 
1848                                                        nx, ny, 
1849                                                        best_radius))
1850            
1851            # Find the maximum value coordinates within curr_sum
1852            cx, _ = np.unravel_index(np.argmax(curr_intensity_sum),
1853                                     [len(curr_intensity_sum),1])
1854                    
1855            # Check for improvement of criterion -- in each iteration just once,
1856            # as the algorithm checks the neighbourhood of the best center (in
1857            # each iteration, the center is updated if possible)
1858            if max(curr_intensity_sum) > max_intensity_sum:                           
1859                max_intensity_sum = max(curr_intensity_sum)
1860                
1861                # Calculate the new best coordinates of the center
1862                n = neighbors[cx]
1863                (nx, ny) = tuple(map(lambda x, y: float(x) + float(y), 
1864                                     best_center, n))
1865                best_center = px, py = (np.copy(nx), np.copy(ny))
1866    
1867            # Update maximum intensity sum 
1868            max_intensity_sum = self.intensity_sum(image, 
1869                                                    best_center[0], 
1870                                                    best_center[1], 
1871                                                    best_radius)
1872
1873        
1874            # Refine radius if necessary while keeping the center position 
1875            # constant. It iterates through different radius adjustments to find
1876            # a radius that maximizes the intensity sum of pixels
1877            
1878            radi_intensity_sum = []
1879            radii = np.arange(-1.0, 1.0 + step, step)
1880            for dr in radii:
1881                new_radius = best_radius + dr
1882                radi_intensity_sum.append(self.intensity_sum(image, 
1883                                                            best_center[0], 
1884                                                            best_center[1], 
1885                                                            new_radius))
1886                
1887            # Find the maximum value coordinates within curr_sum
1888            rx, _ = np.unravel_index(np.argmax(radi_intensity_sum),
1889                                      [len(radi_intensity_sum),1])
1890
1891            # Check for improvement of criterion
1892            if max(radi_intensity_sum) > max_intensity_sum:
1893                max_intensity_sum = max(radi_intensity_sum)
1894                
1895                n = radii[rx]
1896                nr = best_radius+n
1897                
1898                best_radius = pr = np.copy(nr)
1899                
1900            
1901            # Check for convergence and improvement (termination conditions)
1902            impr = abs(max_intensity_sum - curr)
1903            if impr < convergence_threshold:
1904                no_improvement_count += 1
1905                if no_improvement_count == 25:
1906                    break
1907                
1908
1909        
1910        # Avoid incorrect/redundant refinement
1911        ## (1) swapped coordinates
1912        if ((bckup[0] > bckup[1] and not best_center[0] > best_center[1])
1913            or  (bckup[0] < bckup[1] and not best_center[0] < best_center[1])):
1914            best_center = best_center[::-1]
1915        
1916        ## (2) worsened final maximum intensity sum than the initial one
1917        if np.round(init_sum,-2) > np.round(max_intensity_sum,-2):
1918            print("Refinement redundant.")
1919            best_center = np.copy(bckup)
1920    
1921        # Print results
1922        if self.messages:
1923            print("CenterLocator: manual detection + adjustment:")
1924            print(f"Estimated center {px:.2f} {py:.2f}")
1925                
1926        return best_center[0], best_center[1], best_radius
1927    
1928    
1929    def get_circle_pixels(self, xc, yc, radius, num_points=360):
1930        '''         
1931        Get coordinates of pixels defining circle border
1932    
1933        Parameters
1934        ----------
1935        self.image_path : str
1936            direct path to a image with diffraction patterns
1937        xc : float64
1938            x-coordinate of the detected center
1939        yc : float64
1940            y-coordinate of the detected center
1941        radius : float64
1942            radius of the detected center
1943        num_points : float64 
1944            number of border points. The default is 360
1945        
1946        Returns
1947        -------
1948        x : array of float64
1949            x-coordinates of pixels from circle border
1950        y : array of float64
1951            y-coordinates of pixels from circle border
1952            
1953        '''
1954        
1955        # Generate angles from 0 to 2*pi
1956        theta = np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, num=num_points)  
1957                
1958        # Calculate x,y-coordinates of points on the actual circle border
1959        x_actual = xc + radius * np.cos(theta)
1960        y_actual = yc + radius * np.sin(theta)
1961        
1962        return x_actual, y_actual
1963          
1964    
1965    def intensity_sum(self, image, px, py, pr):
1966        ''' 
1967        Summation of intensity values of pixels of a diffraction pattern.
1968
1969        Parameters
1970        ----------
1971        image : array of uint8
1972            image from which the diffraction pattern has been detected.
1973        px : float64
1974            x-coordinate of the center of the diffraction pattern.
1975        py : float64
1976            y-coordinate of the center of the diffraction pattern.
1977        pr : float64
1978            radius of the diffraction pattern.
1979
1980        Returns
1981        -------
1982        s : float64
1983            intensity sum
1984
1985        '''
1986        # Extract pixels on the circle border
1987        pxc, pyc = self.get_circle_pixels(px, py, pr)
1988        pxc = np.array(pxc, dtype=int)
1989        pyc = np.array(pyc, dtype=int)
1990        
1991        # Calculate sum using the filtered values
1992        s = np.sum(image[pyc, pxc])/len(pxc)
1993        return s
1994
1995   
1996    def intensity_var(self, image, px, py, pr):
1997        ''' 
1998        Variance of intensity values of pixels of a diffraction pattern.
1999
2000        Parameters
2001        ----------
2002        image : array of uint8
2003            image from which the diffraction pattern has been detected.
2004        px : float64
2005            x-coordinate of the center of the diffraction pattern.
2006        py : float64
2007            y-coordinate of the center of the diffraction pattern.
2008        pr : float64
2009            radius of the diffraction pattern.
2010
2011        Returns
2012        -------
2013        s : float64
2014            intensity variance
2015
2016        '''
2017        # Extract pixels on the circle border
2018        pxc, pyc = self.get_circle_pixels(px, py, pr)
2019        pxc = np.array(pxc, dtype=int)
2020        pyc = np.array(pyc, dtype=int)
2021        
2022        # Calculate sum using the filtered values
2023        s = np.var(image[pxc, pyc])
2024        return s

2093class HandlerCircle(HandlerBase):
2094    '''
2095    Help class for visualization. Not to be used outside of the module.
2096    '''
2097    def create_artists(self, legend, orig_handle,
2098                       xdescent, ydescent, width, height, fontsize, trans):
2099        # Create a circular marker
2100        x = width / 2
2101        y = height / 2
2102        r = min(width, height) / 2
2103        marker = Circle((x, y), r, facecolor=orig_handle.get_facecolor(),
2104                        edgecolor=orig_handle.get_edgecolor(),
2105                        linewidth=orig_handle.get_linewidth(),
2106                        transform=trans)
2107        return [marker]

2109
2110class IntensityCenter: 
2111    '''
2112    Simple center determination for a symmetric diffractogram.
2113    
2114    * The center is determined as a center of intensity.
2115    * This works well for simple, symmetric diffraction patters, which are:
2116      (i) without beamstopper, (ii) pre-centered, and (iii) powder-like.
2117    * A real-life example of a simple symmetric diffractogram:
2118      a good powder electron diffraction pattern from STEMDIFF software.
2119    * This class is a legacy from previous EDIFF versions;
2120      it is kept mostly for backward compatibility.
2121      The functions in this class can be (and should be)
2122      replaced by a simple call of ediff.center.CenterLocator object.
2123      
2124    >>> # Center determination in a simple symmetric diffraction pattern
2125    >>> # (center = just center_of_intensity, no refinement
2126    >>>
2127    >>> # (1) Old way = this (old, legacy) IntensityCenter class:
2128    >>> xc,yc = ediff.center.IntensityCenter.center_of_intensity(
2129    >>>     arr, csquare=30, cintensity=0.8)
2130    >>>
2131    >>> # (2) New way = newer (and more universal) CenterLocator class:
2132    >>> xc,yc = ediff.center.CenterLocator(
2133    >>>     arr, detection_method='intensity', csquare=30, cintensity=0.8)
2134    '''
2135    
2136    @staticmethod
2137    def center_of_intensity(arr, csquare=20, cintensity=0.8):
2138        '''
2139        Find center of intensity/mass of an array.
2140        
2141        Parameters
2142        ----------
2143        arr : 2D-numpy array
2144            The array, whose intensity center will be determined.
2145        csquare : int, optional, default is 20
2146            The size/edge of the square in the (geometrical) center.
2147            The intensity center is searched only within the central square.
2148            Reasons: To avoid other spots/diffractions and
2149            to minimize the effect of an intensity assymetry around center. 
2150        cintensity : float, optional, default is 0.8
2151            The intensity fraction.
2152            When searching the intensity center, we will consider only
2153            pixels with intensity > max.intensity.
2154            
2155        Returns
2156        -------
2157        xc,yc : float,float
2158            XY-coordinates of the intensity/mass center of the array.
2159            Round XY-coordinates if you use them for image/array calculations.    
2160        '''
2161        # Get image/array size
2162        xsize,ysize = arr.shape
2163        # Calculate borders around the central square
2164        xborder = (xsize - csquare) // 2
2165        yborder = (ysize - csquare) // 2
2166        # Create central square = cut off the borders
2167        arr2 = arr[xborder:-xborder,yborder:-yborder].copy()
2168        # In the central square, set all values below cintenstity to zero
2169        arr2 = np.where(arr2>np.max(arr2)*cintensity, arr2, 0)
2170        # Calculate 1st central moments of the image
2171        M = sk.measure.moments(arr2,1)
2172        # Calculate the intensity center = centroid according to www-help
2173        (xc,yc) = (M[1,0]/M[0,0], M[0,1]/M[0,0])
2174        # We have centroid of the central square => recalculate to whole image
2175        (xc,yc) = (xc+xborder,yc+yborder)
2176        
2177        ## Return the final center
2178        return(xc,yc)
class CenterEstimator: 
 170class CenterEstimator:
 171    '''
 172    Detection of the center of diffraction patterns.
 173    
 174    The center can be estimated in one of the following ways:
 175    
 176    * Center of the intensity/mass in selected area.
 177    * Center from three points (defined interactivelly)
 178      which define one ring in a powder electron diffraction pattern.
 179    * Center estimated from Hough transform,
 180      which detects circles in the diffraction pattern.
 181    
 182    SUBCLASS : CenterLocator
 183    
 184    * the subclass refines the position of the estimated center 
 185        
 186    Parameters
 187    ----------
 188    image_path : string
 189        direct path to an image with diffraction patterns
 190    detection_method : string
 191        Selection of a method for center calculation. String codes are:
 192            - 'manual' : manual detection via 3 points
 193            - 'intensity' : detection via maximum intensity
 194            - 'hough' : automatic detection via Hough transform
 195    correction_method : string
 196       Selection of a method for center position correction. Default is None.
 197       String codes are:
 198           - 'manual' : manual corection 
 199           - 'variance' : correction via variance minimization 
 200           - 'sum' : correction via sum maximization
 201    heq : boolean, optional, default is False
 202        Allow histogram equalization.
 203        The equalization is virtual, the original image is unchanged.
 204    icut : integer, optional, default is None
 205        Intensity cut to enhance image contrast.
 206        Example: icut=300, all pixels intensities >300 are set to 300.
 207    cmap : str, optional, default is 'gray'
 208        Name of matplotlib colormap.
 209        Any valid colormap ('viridis','magma') can be used.
 210    messages : bool, optional, default is False
 211        Print to terminal additional messages about program run.
 212    
 213    Returns
 214    -------
 215    self.x : float
 216        x-coordinate of the detected center
 217    self.y : float
 218        y-coordinate of the detected center
 219    self.r : float
 220        radius of the detected center (if available, othervise returns None)        
 221    '''
 222    
 223    def __init__(self, input_image, 
 224                       detection_method = None, 
 225                       correction_method = None,
 226                       heq = False, 
 227                       icut = None,
 228                       cmap = 'gray',
 229                       csquare=50,
 230                       cintensity=0.8,
 231                       messages = False):
 232        
 233        # Initialize attributes
 234        self.input_image = input_image
 235        
 236        # Allow input images (np.ndarray) and image path
 237        if isinstance(input_image, np.ndarray):
 238            self.image = input_image
 239        else:
 240            self.image = ediff.io.read_image(self.input_image)
 241            
 242        self.correction_method = correction_method
 243        self.heq = heq
 244        self.icut = icut
 245        self.to_refine = []
 246        self.cmap = cmap
 247        self.messages = messages
 248        
 249        # Initialize the marker size and zoom level
 250        self.marker_size = 100  # Adjust this initial value as desired
 251        
 252        # Run functions
 253        self.preprocess_images(preInit = 1)
 254
 255        # Determine detection method
 256        if detection_method == 'manual':
 257            self.x, self.y, self.r = self.detection_3points()
 258            
 259        elif detection_method == 'intensity':
 260            self.x, self.y, self.r = self.detection_intensity(csquare, cintensity)
 261
 262        elif detection_method == 'hough':
 263            self.x, self.y, self.r = self.detection_Hough()  
 264        else:
 265            print("Incorrect method for detection selected")
 266            sys.exit()
 267
 268            
 269    def detection_intensity(self, csquare, cintensity, plot_results=0):
 270        '''
 271        Find center of intensity/mass of an array.
 272        
 273        Parameters
 274        ----------
 275        arr : 2D-numpy array
 276            The array, whose intensity center will be determined.
 277        csquare : int, optional, default is 20
 278            The size/edge of the square in the (geometrical) center.
 279            The intensity center will be searched only within the central square.
 280            Reasons: To avoid other spots/diffractions and
 281            to minimize the effect of possible intensity assymetry around center. 
 282        cintensity : float, optional, default is 0.8
 283            The intensity fraction.
 284            When searching the intensity center, we will consider only
 285            pixels with intensity > max.intensity.
 286            
 287        Returns
 288        -------
 289        xc,yc : float,float
 290            XY-coordinates of the intensity/mass center of the array.
 291            Round XY-coordinates if you use them for image/array calculations.
 292        '''  
 293        
 294        # (1) Get image/array size
 295        image = np.copy(self.to_refine)
 296        arr = np.copy(image)
 297        xsize,ysize = arr.shape
 298        
 299        # (2) Calculate borders around the central square
 300        xborder = (xsize - csquare) // 2
 301        yborder = (ysize - csquare) // 2
 302        
 303        # (3) Create the central square,
 304        # from which the intensity center will be detected
 305        arr2 = arr[xborder:-xborder,yborder:-yborder].copy()
 306        
 307        # (4) In the central square,
 308        # set all values below cintenstity to zero
 309        arr2 = np.where(arr2>np.max(arr2)*cintensity, arr2, 0)
 310        
 311        # (5) Determine the intensity center from image moments
 312        # see image moments in...
 313        # skimage: https://scikit-image.org/docs/dev/api/skimage.measure.html
 314        # wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image_moment -> Centroid
 315        # ---
 316        # (a) Calculate 1st central moments of the image
 317        M = moments(arr2,1)
 318        # (b) Calculate the intensity center = centroid according to www-help
 319        (self.x, self.y) = (M[1,0]/M[0,0], M[0,1]/M[0,0])
 320        # (c) We have centroid of the central square
 321        # but we have to recalculate it to the whole image
 322        (self.x, self.y) = (self.x + xborder, self.y + yborder)
 323        # (d) Radius of a diffraction ring is hardcoded to 100 here
 324        # TODO: consider improving/correcting/removing in the future
 325        self.r = 100
 326        
 327        # (6) User information (if required)
 328        if self.messages:
 329            print("--- IntensityCenter = center of intensity/mass ---")
 330            print(f"Center coordinates [x, y]: [{self.x:.3f}, {self.y:.3f}]")
 331            print("---")
 332
 333        # (7) Plot results (if required)
 334        if plot_results == 1:
 335           self.visualize_center(self.x, self.y, self.r) 
 336                
 337        # (8) Return the results:
 338        # a) XY-coordinates of the center
 339        # b) radius of the circle/diff.ring,
 340        #    from which the center was determined
 341        # ! radius of the circle is just hardcoded here - see TODO note above
 342        return(self.x, self.y, self.r)
 343
 344            
 345    def detection_3points(self, plot_results=1):
 346        '''         
 347        In the input image, select manually 3 points defining a circle using
 348        a key press event 
 349            - press '1' to select a point
 350                
 351        If the user is not satisfied with the point selection, it can be
 352        deleted using a key press event:
 353            - press '2' to delete the most recent
 354            - press '3' to delete the point closest to the cursor
 355        
 356        If the user is satisified with the points selected, the rest 
 357        of the program will be executed 
 358            - press 'd' to proceed >DONE<
 359        
 360        Coordinates of the center and radius will be calculated automatically
 361        using method self.calculate_circle()
 362        
 363        In addition, the user will be able to manually adjust the original
 364        center position by using pre-defined keys.
 365        
 366        Parameters
 367        ----------
 368        plot_results : int, binary
 369            Plot the pattern determined by pixels selected by the user.
 370            Default is 1. To cancel visualization, set plot_results = 0.
 371        
 372        Returns
 373        -------
 374        self.x : float64
 375            x-coordinate of the detected center
 376        self.y : float64
 377            y-coordinate of the detected center
 378        self.r : float64
 379            radius of the detected center
 380            (if available, othervise returns None)
 381                                    
 382        '''
 383        
 384        # Load image
 385        im = self.to_refine
 386    
 387        # Create a figure and display the image
 388        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 12))
 389        
 390        # Allow using arrows to move back and forth between view ports
 391        plt.rcParams['keymap.back'].append('left')
 392        plt.rcParams['keymap.forward'].append('right')
 393 
 394        plt.title("Select 3 points defining one of diffraction circles", 
 395                  fontsize = 20)
 396        ax.imshow(im, cmap = self.cmap)
 397        ax.axis('off')
 398
 399        # User information:
 400        if self.messages:
 401            print("--- ThreePoints = semi-automated center detection ---")
 402            print()
 403            print("Select 3 points to define a circle in the diffractogram:")
 404            print("Use these keys for the selection:")
 405            print("  - '1' : define a point at current cursor position")
 406            print("  - '2' : delete the last point")
 407            print("  - '3' : delete the point closest to the cursor")
 408            print("  - 'd' : done = finished = go to the next step")
 409            print()
 410            print("Close the figure to terminate. No center will be detected.")
 411            print("---")
 412       
 413        # Enable interactive mode
 414        # (figure is updated after every plotting command
 415        # (so that calling figure.show() is not necessary
 416        plt.ion()
 417 
 418        # Initialize the list of coordinates
 419        self.coords = [] 
 420        
 421        # Initialize all flags and counters
 422        calculate_circle_flag = False          # press 'd' event
 423        termination_flag = False               # close window event
 424        point_counter = 0                      # number of selected points
 425        
 426        ### Define the event handler for figure close event
 427        def onclose(event):
 428            nonlocal termination_flag
 429            termination_flag = True
 430            if self.messages:
 431                print('Execution terminated.')
 432 
 433        # Connect the event handler to the figure close event
 434        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('close_event', onclose)
 435        
 436        
 437        ### Define the callback function for key press events
 438        def onkeypress(event):
 439            # nonlocal to modify the flag variable in the outer scope
 440            nonlocal calculate_circle_flag, point_counter, termination_flag
 441            
 442            # Store the zoom level
 443            current_xlim = ax.get_xlim()
 444            current_ylim = ax.get_ylim()
 445 
 446            ## Delete points -- the closest to the cursor
 447            if event.key == '3':
 448                point_counter -= 1
 449                if len(self.coords) > 0:
 450                    pointer_x, pointer_y = event.xdata, event.ydata
 451                    distances = [
 452                        np.sqrt((x - pointer_x)**2 + (y - pointer_y)**2)
 453                        for x, y in self.coords]
 454                    closest_index = np.argmin(distances)
 455                    del self.coords[closest_index]
 456    
 457                    ## Redraw the image without the deleted point
 458                    ax.clear()
 459                    ax.imshow(self.to_refine, cmap = self.cmap)
 460                    for x, y in self.coords:
 461                        ax.scatter(x, y, 
 462                                   c='r', marker='x', 
 463                                   s=self.marker_size)
 464
 465                    my_plot_title = (
 466                        "Select 3 points to define "
 467                        "one of diffraction circles.")
 468                    plt.title(my_plot_title, fontsize=20)
 469                    
 470                    # Retore the previous zoom level
 471                    ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
 472                    ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
 473                    ax.axis('off')
 474                    
 475                    fig.canvas.draw()
 476                else:
 477                    print("No points to delete.")
 478    
 479            # Delete recent point (last added) -- independent on the cursor
 480            if event.key == '2':
 481                # Check if there are points to delete
 482                if point_counter > 0:  
 483                    point_counter -= 1
 484                    if len(self.coords) > 0:
 485                        # Delete the last point in the list
 486                        del self.coords[-1]
 487                        if self.messages:
 488                            print('The most recently selected point deleted.')
 489                            print('Please select a new one.')
 490    
 491                        # Redraw the image without the deleted point
 492                        ax.clear()
 493                        ax.imshow(self.to_refine, cmap = self.cmap)
 494                        for x, y in self.coords:
 495                            ax.scatter(x, y,
 496                                       c='r', marker='x', 
 497                                       s=self.marker_size)
 498
 499                        my_plot_title = (
 500                            "Select 3 points to define "
 501                            "one of diffraction circles.")
 502                        plt.title(my_plot_title)
 503                        
 504                        # Retore the previous zoom level
 505                        ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
 506                        ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
 507                        ax.axis('off')
 508
 509                        fig.canvas.draw()
 510                else:
 511                    print("No points to delete.")
 512                    
 513            ## Select points 
 514            elif event.key == '1':
 515                # Only allow selecting up to three points
 516                if point_counter < 3:  
 517                    # Save the coordinates of the clicked point
 518                    new_point = (event.xdata, event.ydata)
 519                    
 520                    if new_point in self.coords:
 521                        # Do not allow multiple selection of one point
 522                        print("The selected point already exists.")
 523                    else:
 524                        # Add selected point
 525                        self.coords.append(new_point)
 526    
 527                        # Visualize the selected point on the image
 528                        ax.scatter(event.xdata, event.ydata, 
 529                                   c='r', marker='x', 
 530                                   s=self.marker_size)
 531
 532                        # Restore the previous zoom level
 533                        ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
 534                        ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
 535                        ax.axis('off')
 536
 537                        fig.canvas.draw()
 538    
 539                        point_counter += 1
 540                else: # 3 points selected
 541                    print("3 points already selected.")
 542    
 543                if len(self.coords) == 3:
 544                    # Turn off interactive mode
 545                    plt.ioff()
 546    
 547                    if self.messages:
 548                        print("3 points selected.")
 549                        print("Press 'd' to calculate the center position.")
 550    
 551            # Calculate circle or terminate
 552            elif event.key == 'd':
 553                if len(self.coords) == 3:
 554                    calculate_circle_flag = True
 555 
 556                else:
 557                    print("Select exactly 3 points to calculate the circle.")
 558                    fig.canvas.draw()
 559    
 560        # Connect the callback function to the key press event
 561        cid0 = fig.canvas.mpl_connect('key_press_event', onkeypress)
 562
 563        # Show the plot
 564        plt.tight_layout()
 565        ax.axis('off')
 566
 567        plt.show(block=False)
 568      
 569        # Wait for 'd' key event or close the figure if no points are selected
 570        while not calculate_circle_flag and not termination_flag:
 571 
 572            try:
 573                plt.waitforbuttonpress(timeout=0.1)
 574                # Store the zoom level
 575                current_xlim = ax.get_xlim()
 576                current_ylim = ax.get_ylim()
 577 
 578                # Plot detected diffraction pattern
 579                if calculate_circle_flag:
 580 
 581                    self.calculate_circle(plot_results=0)
 582                    
 583                    ax.clear()
 584                    ax.imshow(self.to_refine, cmap = self.cmap)
 585                    # Retore the previous zoom level
 586                    ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
 587                    ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
 588                 
 589                    circle = plt.Circle(
 590                        (self.x, self.y), self.r, color='r', fill=False)
 591                    ax.add_artist(circle)
 592        
 593                    # Plot center point
 594                    center, = ax.plot(self.x, self.y, 'rx', markersize=12)
 595                    plt.title('Manually adjust the position of the center using keys.')
 596        
 597                    # Display the image
 598                    plt.draw()
 599                    ax.axis('off')
 600
 601                    plt.show(block = False)
 602
 603            except KeyboardInterrupt:
 604                print("Execution manually interrupted by user.")
 605                break
 606            except ValueError as e:
 607                print("ValueError:", e)
 608                break
 609           
 610        # If the termination_flag is True, stop the code
 611        if termination_flag: 
 612             print("No points selected. Returned None values.")
 613             sys.exit()
 614             return None, None, None
 615        
 616        # Disconnect key press events
 617        fig.canvas.mpl_disconnect(cid0) 
 618        
 619        # local variables save
 620        self.center = center
 621        
 622        self.backip = [self.x, self.y, self.r]
 623        # Manually adjust the calculated center coordinates
 624        self.x, self.y, self.r = self.adjustment_3points(fig, circle, center)
 625
 626        # Return the results:
 627        # a) XY-coordinates of the center
 628        # b) radius of the circle/diff.ring,
 629        #    from which the center was determined
 630        return(self.x, self.y, self.r)
 631
 632    
 633    def adjustment_3points(self, fig, circle, center, plot_results=0):
 634        '''
 635        Adjustment of the center position calculated from 3 points.
 636        Interactive refinement using keys:
 637
 638        The user can change the position of the center of the diffraction
 639        pattern and also the radius of the detected pattern using keys:
 640            - left / right / top / down arrows : move left / right / top / down
 641            - '+' : increase radius
 642            - '-' : decrease radius
 643            - 'd' : done, termination of the refinement
 644
 645        If the interactive figure is closed without any modifications,
 646        the function returns input variables and the proccess terminates.
 647        
 648        Parameters
 649        ----------
 650        fig : figure.Figure object
 651            interactive figure in which a diffraction pattern has been
 652            manually detected.
 653        circle : patches.Circle object
 654            circle defined via 3 points manually delected
 655        center : tuple
 656            calculated center of the input circle.
 657        plot_results : boolean
 658            visualize results. The default is 1 (plot detected center).
 659
 660        Returns
 661        -------
 662        xy : tuple
 663            x,y-coordinates of the center of the diffraction pattern.
 664        r : integer
 665            radius of the diffraction pattern.
 666
 667        '''
 668        # Remove default left / right arrow key press events
 669        plt.rcParams['keymap.back'].remove('left')
 670        plt.rcParams['keymap.forward'].remove('right')
 671        
 672        if self.messages:
 673            print("--- Interactive center refinement ---")
 674            print("Use these keys:")
 675            print("  - 'leftArrow'  : move left")
 676            print("  - 'RightArrow' : move right")
 677            print("  - 'UpArrow'    : move up")
 678            print("  - 'DownArrow'  : move down")
 679            print("  - '+' : increase circle radius")
 680            print("  - '-' : decrease circle radius")
 681            print("  - 'd' : refinement done")
 682            print("Technical note:")
 683            print("  the default shortcuts for LeftArrow and RightArrow")
 684            print("  temporarily overriden, but corresponding icons do work.")
 685        
 686        # Initialize variables and flags
 687        self.backip = np.array((self.x, self.y))
 688        xy = np.array((self.x, self.y))
 689        r = np.copy(self.r)
 690        termination_flag = False
 691        
 692        plt.title("Manually adjust the center position.", fontsize=20)
 693
 694        plt.ion()
 695          
 696        ### Define the event handler for figure close event
 697        def onclose(event):
 698            nonlocal termination_flag
 699            termination_flag = True
 700            if self.messages:
 701                print('Execution terminated.')
 702 
 703        # Connect the event handler to the figure close event
 704        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('close_event', onclose)
 705        
 706        # Define the callback function for key press events
 707        def onkeypress2(event):
 708            # Use nonlocal to modify the center position in the outer scope
 709            nonlocal xy, r, termination_flag
 710
 711            # OTHER KEYS USED IN INTERACTIVE FIGURES
 712            #   event.key == '1': select a point in self.detection_3points()
 713            #   event.key == '2': delete the last point in self.detection...
 714            #   event.key == '3': delete a point in self.detection...
 715            #   event.key == 'd': proceed in self.detection_3points()
 716            
 717            if event.key in ['up', 'down', 'left', 'right', '+', '-']:
 718                if event.key in ['+', '-']:
 719                    r += 1 if event.key == '+' else -1
 720                else:
 721                    # Perform shifts normally
 722                    if event.key == 'up':
 723                        xy[1] -= 0.5
 724                       # print('Moved up')
 725                    elif event.key == 'down':
 726                        xy[1] += 0.5
 727                       # print('Moved down')
 728                    elif event.key == 'left':
 729                        xy[0] -= 0.5
 730                       # print('Moved left')
 731                    elif event.key == 'right':
 732                        xy[0] += 0.5
 733                       # print('Moved right')
 734
 735            # Terminate the interactive refinement with 'd' key
 736            if event.key == 'd':
 737                termination_flag = True
 738                if self.messages:
 739                    print("--- Refinement done. ---")
 740
 741            # Update the plot with the new center position
 742            circle.set_center((xy[0], xy[1]))  # circle
 743            circle.set_radius(r)               # radius
 744            center.set_data([xy[0]], [xy[1]])  # center
 745
 746            plt.title("Manually adjust the center position.", fontsize=20)
 747         
 748            # Update the plot
 749            plt.draw() 
 750        
 751        # Disconnect the on_key_press1 event handler from the figure
 752        fig.canvas.mpl_disconnect(fig.canvas.manager.key_press_handler_id)
 753        
 754        # Connect the callback function to the key press event
 755        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('key_press_event', onkeypress2)
 756
 757        # Enable interaction mode
 758        plt.ion() 
 759               
 760        # Wait for 'd' key press or figure closure
 761        while not termination_flag:
 762            try:
 763                plt.waitforbuttonpress(timeout=0.1)
 764            except KeyboardInterrupt:
 765                # If the user manually closes the figure, terminate the loop
 766                termination_flag = True
 767                
 768        # Turn off interactive mode
 769        plt.ioff()
 770        
 771        # Display the final figure with the selected center position and radius
 772        plt.tight_layout()
 773
 774        plt.show(block=False)
 775        
 776        # If the termination_flag is True, stop the code
 777        if termination_flag: 
 778            plt.close()  # Close the figure
 779
 780        # Print results
 781        if self.messages:
 782            print("CenterEstimator :: manual detection + adjustment")
 783            print(f"Center coordinates: {xy[0]:.2f} {xy[1]:.2f}")
 784        
 785    
 786        return xy[0], xy[1], r
 787    
 788        
 789    def detection_Hough(self, plot_results=0):
 790        '''        
 791        Perform Hough transform to detect center of diffraction patterns.
 792        This is a method to automatically detect circular diffraction patterns
 793        
 794        Parameters
 795        ----------
 796        plot_results : int, binary
 797            Plot the pattern determined by pixels selected by the user.
 798            Default is 1. To cancel visualization, set plot_results = 0.
 799
 800        Returns
 801        -------
 802        self.x : float64
 803            x-coordinate of the detected center
 804        self.y : float64
 805            y-coordinate of the detected center
 806        self.r : float64
 807            radius of the detected center
 808                                    
 809        '''
 810        ## Image preprocessing
 811        im = np.copy(self.to_refine)
 812        
 813        # if the brightness of the image is small enough, pixel values greater
 814        # than 50 will be set to 0 -- removal of the beam stopper influence
 815        
 816        if self.heq == 0:
 817            if sum(sum(im)) < 150000:
 818                    max_indices = np.where(im > 50)
 819        
 820                    row_idx = max_indices[0]
 821                    col_idx = max_indices[1]
 822        
 823                    im[row_idx, col_idx] = 0    
 824                
 825            # Detect edges using the Canny edge detector
 826            edges = sk.feature.canny(im, 
 827                                     sigma=0.2, 
 828                                     low_threshold=80, 
 829                                     high_threshold=100)
 830        elif self.heq == 1:
 831            if sum(sum(im)) > 40000:
 832                max_indices = np.where(im > 50)
 833
 834                row_idx = max_indices[0]
 835                col_idx = max_indices[1]
 836
 837                im[row_idx, col_idx] = 0    
 838            
 839            # Detect edges using the Canny edge detector
 840            edges = sk.feature.canny(im, 
 841                                     sigma=0.2, 
 842                                     low_threshold=0.80, 
 843                                     high_threshold=1)
 844        
 845        
 846        # Define the radii range for the concentric circles
 847        # (set empirically based on the available pictures)
 848        min_radius = 40
 849        max_radius = 200
 850        radius_step = 10
 851        radii = np.arange(min_radius, max_radius + radius_step, radius_step)
 852
 853        ### Perform the Hough transform to detect circles
 854        # Circle detection involves converting edge pixels into parameter space, 
 855        # where each point represents a possible circle center and radius. 
 856        # The circles are then identified as peaks in the parameter space, 
 857        # enabling accurate detection of circular shapes in the image.
 858        hough_res = hough_circle(edges, radii)
 859
 860        # Extract the circle peaks
 861        _, self.x, self.y, self.r = hough_circle_peaks(hough_res, 
 862                                                            radii, 
 863                                                            total_num_peaks=1)
 864        
 865        
 866        # User information:
 867        if self.messages:
 868            print("------------ Diffraction pattern detection via Hough transform -----------")
 869            print("Central coordinate [ x, y ]: [{:.3f}, {:.3f}]".format(float(self.x), 
 870                                                                         float(self.y)))
 871            print("--------------------------------------------------------------------------")
 872        
 873        
 874        self.x, self.y, self.r = float(self.x[0]), float(self.y[0]), float(self.r[0])
 875
 876        # Return results, convert coordinates to float
 877        return self.x, self.y, self.r
 878
 879   
 880    def calculate_circle(self, plot_results):
 881        ''' 
 882        Calculates coordinates of the center and radius of a circle defined via
 883        3 points determined by the user. Plots the calculated circle, detected 
 884        points and marks the center.
 885        
 886        Parameters
 887        ----------
 888        plot_results : int, binary
 889            Plot the calculated center and circle. To cancel visualization, 
 890            set plot_results = 0.
 891        self.coords : array of float64
 892            Coordinates of 3 manually selected points
 893        
 894        Returns
 895        -------
 896        self.x : float64
 897            x-coordinate of the detected center
 898        self.y : float64
 899            y-coordinate of the detected center
 900        self.r : float64
 901            radius of the detected center
 902                                    
 903        '''
 904        # Extract the coordinates of the points        
 905        x = [self.coords[0][0], self.coords[1][0], self.coords[2][0]]
 906        y = [self.coords[0][1], self.coords[1][1], self.coords[2][1]]
 907        
 908        # Compute the radius and center coordinates of the circle
 909            # a: the squared length of the side between the second 
 910            #    and third points (x[1], y[1]) and (x[2], y[2]).
 911            # b: the squared length of the side between the first 
 912            #    and third points (x[0], y[0]) and (x[2], y[2]).
 913            # c: the squared length of the side between the first 
 914            #    and second points (x[0], y[0]) and (x[1], y[1]).
 915            # s: the twice the signed area of the triangle formed by 3 points
 916            
 917        c = (x[0]-x[1])**2 + (y[0]-y[1])**2
 918        a = (x[1]-x[2])**2 + (y[1]-y[2])**2
 919        b = (x[2]-x[0])**2 + (y[2]-y[0])**2
 920        s = 2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) - (a*a + b*b + c*c) 
 921        
 922        # coordinates of the center
 923        self.x = (a*(b+c-a)*x[0] + b*(c+a-b)*x[1] + c*(a+b-c)*x[2]) / s
 924        self.y = (a*(b+c-a)*y[0] + b*(c+a-b)*y[1] + c*(a+b-c)*y[2]) / s 
 925        
 926        # radius
 927        ar = a**0.5
 928        br = b**0.5
 929        cr = c**0.5 
 930        self.r = ar*br*cr/((ar+br+cr)*(-ar+br+cr)*(ar-br+cr)*(ar+br-cr))**0.5
 931        
 932        # Print results
 933        if self.messages:
 934            print("CenterEstimator :: manual center detection")
 935            print(f"Center coordinates: {self.x:.2f} {self.y:.2f}")
 936                    
 937        if plot_results==1:
 938            # Create and manage the figure
 939            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
 940            manager = plt.get_current_fig_manager()
 941            manager.window.showMaximized()
 942            ax.imshow(self.image, cmap = self.cmap)
 943            
 944            # Plot center and points
 945            center, = plt.plot(self.x, self.y, 
 946                     'rx', 
 947                     label='Center', 
 948                     markersize=12)
 949            plt.scatter(x,y, 
 950                        marker='x', 
 951                        color='palevioletred', 
 952                        label = 'Circle points')
 953            plt.title('Circle found using 3 manually detected points')
 954            
 955            # Circle visualization
 956            circle = plt.Circle((self.x,self.y), 
 957                                self.r, 
 958                                color='palevioletred', 
 959                                fill=False,
 960                                label = 'pattern')
 961            ax.add_artist(circle)
 962            
 963            # Set the aspect ratio to equal to have a circular shape
 964            plt.axis('equal')
 965            
 966            plt.legend(loc='lower center', 
 967                       ncol=2, 
 968                       bbox_to_anchor=(0.5,-0.1), 
 969                       mode='expand', 
 970                       frameon=False)
 971            plt.axis('off')
 972            plt.tight_layout()
 973            plt.show(block=False)
 974
 975        
 976        self.center = (self.x, self.y)
 977        self.circle = plt.Circle((self.x,self.y),self.r)
 978        
 979
 980        return self.x, self.y, self.r, self.center, self.circle
 981
