1031    def central_square(self, arr, csquare, xcenter=None, ycenter=None):
1032        ''' 
1033        Return central square from an array
1034        
1035        Parameters
1036        ----------
1037        arr : 2D-numpy array
1038            The original array from which the central_square will be extracted
1039        csquare : int, optional, default is 20
1040            The size/edge of the square in the (geometrical) center.
1041            The intensity center will be searched only within the central square.
1042            Reasons: To avoid other spots/diffractions and
1043            to minimize the effect of possible intensity assymetry around center. 
1044        xcenter : float64
1045            x-coordinate of array center. Deafault is None
1046        ycenter : float64
1047            y-coordinate of array center. Deafault is None
1048
1049        Returns
1050        -------
1051        arr2 : 2D-numpy array
1052            central square extracted from input array
1053        '''
1054        
1055        xsize, ysize = arr.shape
1056        # If center of was not given, take geometrical center
1057        # (for array selections/slicing, we need integers => round, //
1058        xc = round(xcenter) or xsize // 2
1059        yc = round(ycenter) or ysize // 2
1060        
1061        # Half of the central square
1062        # (for array selections/slicing, we need integers => //
1063        half_csquare = csquare // 2
1064        
1065        # Create sub-array = just central square around xc,yc
1066        arr2 = arr[
1067            xc-half_csquare:xc+half_csquare,
1068            yc-half_csquare:yc+half_csquare].copy()
1069        
1070        return(arr2)

Detection of the center of diffraction patterns.

The center can be estimated in one of the following ways:

  • Center of the intensity/mass in selected area.
  • Center from three points (defined interactivelly) which define one ring in a powder electron diffraction pattern.
  • Center estimated from Hough transform, which detects circles in the diffraction pattern.

SUBCLASS : CenterLocator

  • the subclass refines the position of the estimated center
Parameters
  • image_path (string): direct path to an image with diffraction patterns
  • detection_method (string): Selection of a method for center calculation. String codes are: - 'manual' : manual detection via 3 points - 'intensity' : detection via maximum intensity - 'hough' : automatic detection via Hough transform
  • correction_method (string): Selection of a method for center position correction. Default is None. String codes are: - 'manual' : manual corection - 'variance' : correction via variance minimization - 'sum' : correction via sum maximization
  • heq (boolean, optional, default is False): Allow histogram equalization. The equalization is virtual, the original image is unchanged.
  • icut (integer, optional, default is None): Intensity cut to enhance image contrast. Example: icut=300, all pixels intensities >300 are set to 300.
  • cmap (str, optional, default is 'gray'): Name of matplotlib colormap. Any valid colormap ('viridis','magma') can be used.
  • messages (bool, optional, default is False): Print to terminal additional messages about program run.
Returns
  • self.x (float): x-coordinate of the detected center
  • self.y (float): y-coordinate of the detected center
  • self.r (float): radius of the detected center (if available, othervise returns None)
def detection_intensity(self, csquare, cintensity, plot_results=0): 
269    def detection_intensity(self, csquare, cintensity, plot_results=0):
270        '''
271        Find center of intensity/mass of an array.
272        
273        Parameters
274        ----------
275        arr : 2D-numpy array
276            The array, whose intensity center will be determined.
277        csquare : int, optional, default is 20
278            The size/edge of the square in the (geometrical) center.
279            The intensity center will be searched only within the central square.
280            Reasons: To avoid other spots/diffractions and
281            to minimize the effect of possible intensity assymetry around center. 
282        cintensity : float, optional, default is 0.8
283            The intensity fraction.
284            When searching the intensity center, we will consider only
285            pixels with intensity > max.intensity.
286            
287        Returns
288        -------
289        xc,yc : float,float
290            XY-coordinates of the intensity/mass center of the array.
291            Round XY-coordinates if you use them for image/array calculations.
292        '''  
293        
294        # (1) Get image/array size
295        image = np.copy(self.to_refine)
296        arr = np.copy(image)
297        xsize,ysize = arr.shape
298        
299        # (2) Calculate borders around the central square
300        xborder = (xsize - csquare) // 2
301        yborder = (ysize - csquare) // 2
302        
303        # (3) Create the central square,
304        # from which the intensity center will be detected
305        arr2 = arr[xborder:-xborder,yborder:-yborder].copy()
306        
307        # (4) In the central square,
308        # set all values below cintenstity to zero
309        arr2 = np.where(arr2>np.max(arr2)*cintensity, arr2, 0)
310        
311        # (5) Determine the intensity center from image moments
312        # see image moments in...
313        # skimage: https://scikit-image.org/docs/dev/api/skimage.measure.html
314        # wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image_moment -> Centroid
315        # ---
316        # (a) Calculate 1st central moments of the image
317        M = moments(arr2,1)
318        # (b) Calculate the intensity center = centroid according to www-help
319        (self.x, self.y) = (M[1,0]/M[0,0], M[0,1]/M[0,0])
320        # (c) We have centroid of the central square
321        # but we have to recalculate it to the whole image
322        (self.x, self.y) = (self.x + xborder, self.y + yborder)
323        # (d) Radius of a diffraction ring is hardcoded to 100 here
324        # TODO: consider improving/correcting/removing in the future
325        self.r = 100
326        
327        # (6) User information (if required)
328        if self.messages:
329            print("--- IntensityCenter = center of intensity/mass ---")
330            print(f"Center coordinates [x, y]: [{self.x:.3f}, {self.y:.3f}]")
331            print("---")
332
333        # (7) Plot results (if required)
334        if plot_results == 1:
335           self.visualize_center(self.x, self.y, self.r) 
336                
337        # (8) Return the results:
338        # a) XY-coordinates of the center
339        # b) radius of the circle/diff.ring,
340        #    from which the center was determined
341        # ! radius of the circle is just hardcoded here - see TODO note above
342        return(self.x, self.y, self.r)

Find center of intensity/mass of an array.

Parameters
  • arr (2D-numpy array): The array, whose intensity center will be determined.
  • csquare (int, optional, default is 20): The size/edge of the square in the (geometrical) center. The intensity center will be searched only within the central square. Reasons: To avoid other spots/diffractions and to minimize the effect of possible intensity assymetry around center.
  • cintensity (float, optional, default is 0.8): The intensity fraction. When searching the intensity center, we will consider only pixels with intensity > max.intensity.
Returns
  • xc,yc (float,float): XY-coordinates of the intensity/mass center of the array. Round XY-coordinates if you use them for image/array calculations.
def detection_3points(self, plot_results=1): 
345    def detection_3points(self, plot_results=1):
346        '''         
347        In the input image, select manually 3 points defining a circle using
348        a key press event 
349            - press '1' to select a point
350                
351        If the user is not satisfied with the point selection, it can be
352        deleted using a key press event:
353            - press '2' to delete the most recent
354            - press '3' to delete the point closest to the cursor
355        
356        If the user is satisified with the points selected, the rest 
357        of the program will be executed 
358            - press 'd' to proceed >DONE<
359        
360        Coordinates of the center and radius will be calculated automatically
361        using method self.calculate_circle()
362        
363        In addition, the user will be able to manually adjust the original
364        center position by using pre-defined keys.
365        
366        Parameters
367        ----------
368        plot_results : int, binary
369            Plot the pattern determined by pixels selected by the user.
370            Default is 1. To cancel visualization, set plot_results = 0.
371        
372        Returns
373        -------
374        self.x : float64
375            x-coordinate of the detected center
376        self.y : float64
377            y-coordinate of the detected center
378        self.r : float64
379            radius of the detected center
380            (if available, othervise returns None)
381                                    
382        '''
383        
384        # Load image
385        im = self.to_refine
386    
387        # Create a figure and display the image
388        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 12))
389        
390        # Allow using arrows to move back and forth between view ports
391        plt.rcParams['keymap.back'].append('left')
392        plt.rcParams['keymap.forward'].append('right')
393 
394        plt.title("Select 3 points defining one of diffraction circles", 
395                  fontsize = 20)
396        ax.imshow(im, cmap = self.cmap)
397        ax.axis('off')
398
399        # User information:
400        if self.messages:
401            print("--- ThreePoints = semi-automated center detection ---")
402            print()
403            print("Select 3 points to define a circle in the diffractogram:")
404            print("Use these keys for the selection:")
405            print("  - '1' : define a point at current cursor position")
406            print("  - '2' : delete the last point")
407            print("  - '3' : delete the point closest to the cursor")
408            print("  - 'd' : done = finished = go to the next step")
409            print()
410            print("Close the figure to terminate. No center will be detected.")
411            print("---")
412       
413        # Enable interactive mode
414        # (figure is updated after every plotting command
415        # (so that calling figure.show() is not necessary
416        plt.ion()
417 
418        # Initialize the list of coordinates
419        self.coords = [] 
420        
421        # Initialize all flags and counters
422        calculate_circle_flag = False          # press 'd' event
423        termination_flag = False               # close window event
424        point_counter = 0                      # number of selected points
425        
426        ### Define the event handler for figure close event
427        def onclose(event):
428            nonlocal termination_flag
429            termination_flag = True
430            if self.messages:
431                print('Execution terminated.')
432 
433        # Connect the event handler to the figure close event
434        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('close_event', onclose)
435        
436        
437        ### Define the callback function for key press events
438        def onkeypress(event):
439            # nonlocal to modify the flag variable in the outer scope
440            nonlocal calculate_circle_flag, point_counter, termination_flag
441            
442            # Store the zoom level
443            current_xlim = ax.get_xlim()
444            current_ylim = ax.get_ylim()
445 
446            ## Delete points -- the closest to the cursor
447            if event.key == '3':
448                point_counter -= 1
449                if len(self.coords) > 0:
450                    pointer_x, pointer_y = event.xdata, event.ydata
451                    distances = [
452                        np.sqrt((x - pointer_x)**2 + (y - pointer_y)**2)
453                        for x, y in self.coords]
454                    closest_index = np.argmin(distances)
455                    del self.coords[closest_index]
456    
457                    ## Redraw the image without the deleted point
458                    ax.clear()
459                    ax.imshow(self.to_refine, cmap = self.cmap)
460                    for x, y in self.coords:
461                        ax.scatter(x, y, 
462                                   c='r', marker='x', 
463                                   s=self.marker_size)
464
465                    my_plot_title = (
466                        "Select 3 points to define "
467                        "one of diffraction circles.")
468                    plt.title(my_plot_title, fontsize=20)
469                    
470                    # Retore the previous zoom level
471                    ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
472                    ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
473                    ax.axis('off')
474                    
475                    fig.canvas.draw()
476                else:
477                    print("No points to delete.")
478    
479            # Delete recent point (last added) -- independent on the cursor
480            if event.key == '2':
481                # Check if there are points to delete
482                if point_counter > 0:  
483                    point_counter -= 1
484                    if len(self.coords) > 0:
485                        # Delete the last point in the list
486                        del self.coords[-1]
487                        if self.messages:
488                            print('The most recently selected point deleted.')
489                            print('Please select a new one.')
490    
491                        # Redraw the image without the deleted point
492                        ax.clear()
493                        ax.imshow(self.to_refine, cmap = self.cmap)
494                        for x, y in self.coords:
495                            ax.scatter(x, y,
496                                       c='r', marker='x', 
497                                       s=self.marker_size)
498
499                        my_plot_title = (
500                            "Select 3 points to define "
501                            "one of diffraction circles.")
502                        plt.title(my_plot_title)
503                        
504                        # Retore the previous zoom level
505                        ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
506                        ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
507                        ax.axis('off')
508
509                        fig.canvas.draw()
510                else:
511                    print("No points to delete.")
512                    
513            ## Select points 
514            elif event.key == '1':
515                # Only allow selecting up to three points
516                if point_counter < 3:  
517                    # Save the coordinates of the clicked point
518                    new_point = (event.xdata, event.ydata)
519                    
520                    if new_point in self.coords:
521                        # Do not allow multiple selection of one point
522                        print("The selected point already exists.")
523                    else:
524                        # Add selected point
525                        self.coords.append(new_point)
526    
527                        # Visualize the selected point on the image
528                        ax.scatter(event.xdata, event.ydata, 
529                                   c='r', marker='x', 
530                                   s=self.marker_size)
531
532                        # Restore the previous zoom level
533                        ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
534                        ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
535                        ax.axis('off')
536
537                        fig.canvas.draw()
538    
539                        point_counter += 1
540                else: # 3 points selected
541                    print("3 points already selected.")
542    
543                if len(self.coords) == 3:
544                    # Turn off interactive mode
545                    plt.ioff()
546    
547                    if self.messages:
548                        print("3 points selected.")
549                        print("Press 'd' to calculate the center position.")
550    
551            # Calculate circle or terminate
552            elif event.key == 'd':
553                if len(self.coords) == 3:
554                    calculate_circle_flag = True
555 
556                else:
557                    print("Select exactly 3 points to calculate the circle.")
558                    fig.canvas.draw()
559    
560        # Connect the callback function to the key press event
561        cid0 = fig.canvas.mpl_connect('key_press_event', onkeypress)
562
563        # Show the plot
564        plt.tight_layout()
565        ax.axis('off')
566
567        plt.show(block=False)
568      
569        # Wait for 'd' key event or close the figure if no points are selected
570        while not calculate_circle_flag and not termination_flag:
571 
572            try:
573                plt.waitforbuttonpress(timeout=0.1)
574                # Store the zoom level
575                current_xlim = ax.get_xlim()
576                current_ylim = ax.get_ylim()
577 
578                # Plot detected diffraction pattern
579                if calculate_circle_flag:
580 
581                    self.calculate_circle(plot_results=0)
582                    
583                    ax.clear()
584                    ax.imshow(self.to_refine, cmap = self.cmap)
585                    # Retore the previous zoom level
586                    ax.set_xlim(current_xlim)
587                    ax.set_ylim(current_ylim)
588                 
589                    circle = plt.Circle(
590                        (self.x, self.y), self.r, color='r', fill=False)
591                    ax.add_artist(circle)
592        
593                    # Plot center point
594                    center, = ax.plot(self.x, self.y, 'rx', markersize=12)
595                    plt.title('Manually adjust the position of the center using keys.')
596        
597                    # Display the image
598                    plt.draw()
599                    ax.axis('off')
600
601                    plt.show(block = False)
602
603            except KeyboardInterrupt:
604                print("Execution manually interrupted by user.")
605                break
606            except ValueError as e:
607                print("ValueError:", e)
608                break
609           
610        # If the termination_flag is True, stop the code
611        if termination_flag: 
612             print("No points selected. Returned None values.")
613             sys.exit()
614             return None, None, None
615        
616        # Disconnect key press events
617        fig.canvas.mpl_disconnect(cid0) 
618        
619        # local variables save
620        self.center = center
621        
622        self.backip = [self.x, self.y, self.r]
623        # Manually adjust the calculated center coordinates
624        self.x, self.y, self.r = self.adjustment_3points(fig, circle, center)
625
626        # Return the results:
627        # a) XY-coordinates of the center
628        # b) radius of the circle/diff.ring,
629        #    from which the center was determined
630        return(self.x, self.y, self.r)

In the input image, select manually 3 points defining a circle using a key press event - press '1' to select a point

If the user is not satisfied with the point selection, it can be deleted using a key press event: - press '2' to delete the most recent - press '3' to delete the point closest to the cursor

If the user is satisified with the points selected, the rest of the program will be executed - press 'd' to proceed >DONE<

Coordinates of the center and radius will be calculated automatically using method self.calculate_circle()

In addition, the user will be able to manually adjust the original center position by using pre-defined keys.

Parameters
  • plot_results (int, binary): Plot the pattern determined by pixels selected by the user. Default is 1. To cancel visualization, set plot_results = 0.
Returns
  • self.x (float64): x-coordinate of the detected center
  • self.y (float64): y-coordinate of the detected center
  • self.r (float64): radius of the detected center (if available, othervise returns None)
def adjustment_3points(self, fig, circle, center, plot_results=0): 
633    def adjustment_3points(self, fig, circle, center, plot_results=0):
634        '''
635        Adjustment of the center position calculated from 3 points.
636        Interactive refinement using keys:
637
638        The user can change the position of the center of the diffraction
639        pattern and also the radius of the detected pattern using keys:
640            - left / right / top / down arrows : move left / right / top / down
641            - '+' : increase radius
642            - '-' : decrease radius
643            - 'd' : done, termination of the refinement
644
645        If the interactive figure is closed without any modifications,
646        the function returns input variables and the proccess terminates.
647        
648        Parameters
649        ----------
650        fig : figure.Figure object
651            interactive figure in which a diffraction pattern has been
652            manually detected.
653        circle : patches.Circle object
654            circle defined via 3 points manually delected
655        center : tuple
656            calculated center of the input circle.
657        plot_results : boolean
658            visualize results. The default is 1 (plot detected center).
659
660        Returns
661        -------
662        xy : tuple
663            x,y-coordinates of the center of the diffraction pattern.
664        r : integer
665            radius of the diffraction pattern.
666
667        '''
668        # Remove default left / right arrow key press events
669        plt.rcParams['keymap.back'].remove('left')
670        plt.rcParams['keymap.forward'].remove('right')
671        
672        if self.messages:
673            print("--- Interactive center refinement ---")
674            print("Use these keys:")
675            print("  - 'leftArrow'  : move left")
676            print("  - 'RightArrow' : move right")
677            print("  - 'UpArrow'    : move up")
678            print("  - 'DownArrow'  : move down")
679            print("  - '+' : increase circle radius")
680            print("  - '-' : decrease circle radius")
681            print("  - 'd' : refinement done")
682            print("Technical note:")
683            print("  the default shortcuts for LeftArrow and RightArrow")
684            print("  temporarily overriden, but corresponding icons do work.")
685        
686        # Initialize variables and flags
687        self.backip = np.array((self.x, self.y))
688        xy = np.array((self.x, self.y))
689        r = np.copy(self.r)
690        termination_flag = False
691        
692        plt.title("Manually adjust the center position.", fontsize=20)
693
694        plt.ion()
695          
696        ### Define the event handler for figure close event
697        def onclose(event):
698            nonlocal termination_flag
699            termination_flag = True
700            if self.messages:
701                print('Execution terminated.')
702 
703        # Connect the event handler to the figure close event
704        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('close_event', onclose)
705        
706        # Define the callback function for key press events
707        def onkeypress2(event):
708            # Use nonlocal to modify the center position in the outer scope
709            nonlocal xy, r, termination_flag
710
711            # OTHER KEYS USED IN INTERACTIVE FIGURES
712            #   event.key == '1': select a point in self.detection_3points()
713            #   event.key == '2': delete the last point in self.detection...
714            #   event.key == '3': delete a point in self.detection...
715            #   event.key == 'd': proceed in self.detection_3points()
716            
717            if event.key in ['up', 'down', 'left', 'right', '+', '-']:
718                if event.key in ['+', '-']:
719                    r += 1 if event.key == '+' else -1
720                else:
721                    # Perform shifts normally
722                    if event.key == 'up':
723                        xy[1] -= 0.5
724                       # print('Moved up')
725                    elif event.key == 'down':
726                        xy[1] += 0.5
727                       # print('Moved down')
728                    elif event.key == 'left':
729                        xy[0] -= 0.5
730                       # print('Moved left')
731                    elif event.key == 'right':
732                        xy[0] += 0.5
733                       # print('Moved right')
734
735            # Terminate the interactive refinement with 'd' key
736            if event.key == 'd':
737                termination_flag = True
738                if self.messages:
739                    print("--- Refinement done. ---")
740
741            # Update the plot with the new center position
742            circle.set_center((xy[0], xy[1]))  # circle
743            circle.set_radius(r)               # radius
744            center.set_data([xy[0]], [xy[1]])  # center
745
746            plt.title("Manually adjust the center position.", fontsize=20)
747         
748            # Update the plot
749            plt.draw() 
750        
751        # Disconnect the on_key_press1 event handler from the figure
752        fig.canvas.mpl_disconnect(fig.canvas.manager.key_press_handler_id)
753        
754        # Connect the callback function to the key press event
755        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('key_press_event', onkeypress2)
756
757        # Enable interaction mode
758        plt.ion() 
759               
760        # Wait for 'd' key press or figure closure
761        while not termination_flag:
762            try:
763                plt.waitforbuttonpress(timeout=0.1)
764            except KeyboardInterrupt:
765                # If the user manually closes the figure, terminate the loop
766                termination_flag = True
767                
768        # Turn off interactive mode
769        plt.ioff()
770        
771        # Display the final figure with the selected center position and radius
772        plt.tight_layout()
773
774        plt.show(block=False)
775        
776        # If the termination_flag is True, stop the code
777        if termination_flag: 
778            plt.close()  # Close the figure
779
780        # Print results
781        if self.messages:
782            print("CenterEstimator :: manual detection + adjustment")
783            print(f"Center coordinates: {xy[0]:.2f} {xy[1]:.2f}")
784        
785    
786        return xy[0], xy[1], r

def detection_Hough(self, plot_results=0): 
789    def detection_Hough(self, plot_results=0):
790        '''        
791        Perform Hough transform to detect center of diffraction patterns.
792        This is a method to automatically detect circular diffraction patterns
793        
794        Parameters
795        ----------
796        plot_results : int, binary
797            Plot the pattern determined by pixels selected by the user.
798            Default is 1. To cancel visualization, set plot_results = 0.
799
800        Returns
801        -------
802        self.x : float64
803            x-coordinate of the detected center
804        self.y : float64
805            y-coordinate of the detected center
806        self.r : float64
807            radius of the detected center
808                                    
809        '''
810        ## Image preprocessing
811        im = np.copy(self.to_refine)
812        
813        # if the brightness of the image is small enough, pixel values greater
814        # than 50 will be set to 0 -- removal of the beam stopper influence
815        
816        if self.heq == 0:
817            if sum(sum(im)) < 150000:
818                    max_indices = np.where(im > 50)
819        
820                    row_idx = max_indices[0]
821                    col_idx = max_indices[1]
822        
823                    im[row_idx, col_idx] = 0    
824                
825            # Detect edges using the Canny edge detector
826            edges = sk.feature.canny(im, 
827                                     sigma=0.2, 
828                                     low_threshold=80, 
829                                     high_threshold=100)
830        elif self.heq == 1:
831            if sum(sum(im)) > 40000:
832                max_indices = np.where(im > 50)
833
834                row_idx = max_indices[0]
835                col_idx = max_indices[1]
836
837                im[row_idx, col_idx] = 0    
838            
839            # Detect edges using the Canny edge detector
840            edges = sk.feature.canny(im, 
841                                     sigma=0.2, 
842                                     low_threshold=0.80, 
843                                     high_threshold=1)
844        
845        
846        # Define the radii range for the concentric circles
847        # (set empirically based on the available pictures)
848        min_radius = 40
849        max_radius = 200
850        radius_step = 10
851        radii = np.arange(min_radius, max_radius + radius_step, radius_step)
852
853        ### Perform the Hough transform to detect circles
854        # Circle detection involves converting edge pixels into parameter space, 
855        # where each point represents a possible circle center and radius. 
856        # The circles are then identified as peaks in the parameter space, 
857        # enabling accurate detection of circular shapes in the image.
858        hough_res = hough_circle(edges, radii)
859
860        # Extract the circle peaks
861        _, self.x, self.y, self.r = hough_circle_peaks(hough_res, 
862                                                            radii, 
863                                                            total_num_peaks=1)
864        
865        
866        # User information:
867        if self.messages:
868            print("------------ Diffraction pattern detection via Hough transform -----------")
869            print("Central coordinate [ x, y ]: [{:.3f}, {:.3f}]".format(float(self.x), 
870                                                                         float(self.y)))
871            print("--------------------------------------------------------------------------")
872        
873        
874        self.x, self.y, self.r = float(self.x[0]), float(self.y[0]), float(self.r[0])
875
876        # Return results, convert coordinates to float
877        return self.x, self.y, self.r

Perform Hough transform to detect center of diffraction patterns. This is a method to automatically detect circular diffraction patterns

Parameters
  • plot_results (int, binary): Plot the pattern determined by pixels selected by the user. Default is 1. To cancel visualization, set plot_results = 0.
Returns
  • self.x (float64): x-coordinate of the detected center
  • self.y (float64): y-coordinate of the detected center
  • self.r (float64): radius of the detected center
def calculate_circle(self, plot_results): 
880    def calculate_circle(self, plot_results):
881        ''' 
882        Calculates coordinates of the center and radius of a circle defined via
883        3 points determined by the user. Plots the calculated circle, detected 
884        points and marks the center.
885        
886        Parameters
887        ----------
888        plot_results : int, binary
889            Plot the calculated center and circle. To cancel visualization, 
890            set plot_results = 0.
891        self.coords : array of float64
892            Coordinates of 3 manually selected points
893        
894        Returns
895        -------
896        self.x : float64
897            x-coordinate of the detected center
898        self.y : float64
899            y-coordinate of the detected center
900        self.r : float64
901            radius of the detected center
902                                    
903        '''
904        # Extract the coordinates of the points        
905        x = [self.coords[0][0], self.coords[1][0], self.coords[2][0]]
906        y = [self.coords[0][1], self.coords[1][1], self.coords[2][1]]
907        
908        # Compute the radius and center coordinates of the circle
909            # a: the squared length of the side between the second 
910            #    and third points (x[1], y[1]) and (x[2], y[2]).
911            # b: the squared length of the side between the first 
912            #    and third points (x[0], y[0]) and (x[2], y[2]).
913            # c: the squared length of the side between the first 
914            #    and second points (x[0], y[0]) and (x[1], y[1]).
915            # s: the twice the signed area of the triangle formed by 3 points
916            
917        c = (x[0]-x[1])**2 + (y[0]-y[1])**2
918        a = (x[1]-x[2])**2 + (y[1]-y[2])**2
919        b = (x[2]-x[0])**2 + (y[2]-y[0])**2
920        s = 2*(a*b + b*c + c*a) - (a*a + b*b + c*c) 
921        
922        # coordinates of the center
923        self.x = (a*(b+c-a)*x[0] + b*(c+a-b)*x[1] + c*(a+b-c)*x[2]) / s
924        self.y = (a*(b+c-a)*y[0] + b*(c+a-b)*y[1] + c*(a+b-c)*y[2]) / s 
925        
926        # radius
927        ar = a**0.5
928        br = b**0.5
929        cr = c**0.5 
930        self.r = ar*br*cr/((ar+br+cr)*(-ar+br+cr)*(ar-br+cr)*(ar+br-cr))**0.5
931        
932        # Print results
933        if self.messages:
934            print("CenterEstimator :: manual center detection")
935            print(f"Center coordinates: {self.x:.2f} {self.y:.2f}")
936                    
937        if plot_results==1:
938            # Create and manage the figure
939            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
940            manager = plt.get_current_fig_manager()
941            manager.window.showMaximized()
942            ax.imshow(self.image, cmap = self.cmap)
943            
944            # Plot center and points
945            center, = plt.plot(self.x, self.y, 
946                     'rx', 
947                     label='Center', 
948                     markersize=12)
949            plt.scatter(x,y, 
950                        marker='x', 
951                        color='palevioletred', 
952                        label = 'Circle points')
953            plt.title('Circle found using 3 manually detected points')
954            
955            # Circle visualization
956            circle = plt.Circle((self.x,self.y), 
957                                self.r, 
958                                color='palevioletred', 
959                                fill=False,
960                                label = 'pattern')
961            ax.add_artist(circle)
962            
963            # Set the aspect ratio to equal to have a circular shape
964            plt.axis('equal')
965            
966            plt.legend(loc='lower center', 
967                       ncol=2, 
968                       bbox_to_anchor=(0.5,-0.1), 
969                       mode='expand', 
970                       frameon=False)
971            plt.axis('off')
972            plt.tight_layout()
973            plt.show(block=False)
974
975        
976        self.center = (self.x, self.y)
977        self.circle = plt.Circle((self.x,self.y),self.r)
978        
979
980        return self.x, self.y, self.r, self.center, self.circle

def central_square(self, arr, csquare, xcenter=None, ycenter=None): 
1031    def central_square(self, arr, csquare, xcenter=None, ycenter=None):
1032        ''' 
1033        Return central square from an array
1034        
1035        Parameters
1036        ----------
1037        arr : 2D-numpy array
1038            The original array from which the central_square will be extracted
1039        csquare : int, optional, default is 20
1040            The size/edge of the square in the (geometrical) center.
1041            The intensity center will be searched only within the central square.
1042            Reasons: To avoid other spots/diffractions and
1043            to minimize the effect of possible intensity assymetry around center. 
1044        xcenter : float64
1045            x-coordinate of array center. Deafault is None
1046        ycenter : float64
1047            y-coordinate of array center. Deafault is None
1048
1049        Returns
1050        -------
1051        arr2 : 2D-numpy array
1052            central square extracted from input array
1053        '''
1054        
1055        xsize, ysize = arr.shape
1056        # If center of was not given, take geometrical center
1057        # (for array selections/slicing, we need integers => round, //
1058        xc = round(xcenter) or xsize // 2
1059        yc = round(ycenter) or ysize // 2
1060        
1061        # Half of the central square
1062        # (for array selections/slicing, we need integers => //
1063        half_csquare = csquare // 2
1064        
1065        # Create sub-array = just central square around xc,yc
1066        arr2 = arr[
1067            xc-half_csquare:xc+half_csquare,
1068            yc-half_csquare:yc+half_csquare].copy()
1069        
1070        return(arr2)

Return central square from an array

Parameters
  • arr (2D-numpy array): The original array from which the central_square will be extracted
  • csquare (int, optional, default is 20): The size/edge of the square in the (geometrical) center. The intensity center will be searched only within the central square. Reasons: To avoid other spots/diffractions and to minimize the effect of possible intensity assymetry around center.
  • xcenter (float64): x-coordinate of array center. Deafault is None
  • ycenter (float64): y-coordinate of array center. Deafault is None
Returns
  • arr2 (2D-numpy array): central square extracted from input array
class CenterLocator(CenterEstimator): 
1074class CenterLocator(CenterEstimator):
1075    ''' SUBCLASS of CircleEstimator
1076    ----------
1077    
1078    Automatic adjustment of the center position of diffraction patterns,
1079    which was found using methods defined in the class CircleDetection
1080    
1081    
1082    Parameters
1083    ----------
1084    image_path : string
1085        direct path to an image with diffraction patterns
1086    detection_method : string
1087        Selection of a method for center calculation. String codes are:
1088            - 'manual' : manual detection via 3 points
1089            - 'intensity' : detection via maximum intensity
1090            - 'hough' : automatic detection via Hough transform
1091    correction_method : string
1092       Selection of a method for center position correction. Default is None.
1093       String codes are:
1094           - 'manual' : manual corection 
1095           - 'var' : correction via variance minimization 
1096           - 'sum' : correction via sum maximization
1097    heq : boolean
1098        Allow histogram equalization. The default is 0 (no enhancement)
1099    icut : boolean
1100        Allow image enhancement. The default is 0 (no enhancement)
1101
1102
1103    Returns
1104    -------
1105    self.xx : int32
1106        adjusted x-coordinate of the detected center
1107    self.yy : int32
1108        adjusted y-coordinate of the detected center
1109    self.rr : int32
1110        radius of the detected center

1114    def __init__(self, image_path,
1115                 detection_method, correction_method=None, 
1116                 heq=False, icut=None, cmap='gray',
1117                 messages=False, final_replot=False):
1118        
1119        # (1) Call the constructor of the base class to initialize its methods
1120        super().__init__(image_path,
1121            detection_method, correction_method,
1122            heq=heq, icut=icut, cmap=cmap, messages=messages)
1123        
1124
1125        # (2) Define additional parameter
1126        self.messages = messages
1127        self.image_path = image_path
1128
1129
1130        # (3) Run correction method and get refined parameters
1131        if correction_method is not None:
1132            self.ret = 1
1133            if correction_method == 'manual':
1134                if detection_method == 'manual':
1135                    self.yy, self.xx, self.rr = self.x, self.y, self.r
1136                    self.y, self.x, self.r = self.backip[0], self.backip[1], self.r
1137                elif detection_method == 'intensity':
1138                    self.yy, self.xx, self.rr = \
1139                        self.ref_interactive(self.y, self.x, self.r)
1140                else:
1141                    self.yy, self.xx, self.rr = \
1142                        self.ref_interactive(self.x, self.y, self.r)
1143                        
1144            elif correction_method == 'var':
1145                self.xx, self.yy, self.rr = \
1146                    self.ref_var(self.x, self.y, self.r)
1147                if detection_method == 'manual':
1148                    self.xx, self.yy = self.yy, self.xx
1149                    self.x, self.y = self.y, self.x
1150                    
1151            elif correction_method == 'sum':
1152                self.xx, self.yy, self.rr = \
1153                    self.ref_sum(self.x, self.y, self.r)
1154                if detection_method == 'manual':
1155                    self.xx, self.yy = self.yy, self.xx
1156                    self.x, self.y = self.y, self.x
1157
1158            else:
1159                print("Incorrect method for correction selected")
1160                sys.exit()
1161            
1162            if detection_method == 'hough':
1163                self.x, self.y = self.y, self.x
1164                self.xx, self.yy = self.yy, self.xx
1165
1166            if final_replot:
1167                self.visualize_refinement(
1168                    self.y, self.x, self.r, 
1169                    (self.yy, self.xx), self.rr)
1170        else:
1171            self.ret = 2

1257                                              sigma=0.2, 
1258                                              low_threshold=2.5*np.median(self.to_refine), 
1259                                              high_threshold=3*np.median(self.to_refine))
1260

1288                                             high_threshold=100)

1375    def output(self):
1376        """
1377        Manage variables that should be send as the output of the center 
1378        detection. 
1379        
1380        If there were set parameters detection_method and 
1381        correction method during the class initialization, the output will be
1382        coordinates x, y of the center detected by the detection_method and 
1383        coordinates x, y of refined center position by the correction method.
1384        
1385        If there was not set the correction_method parameter, the function
1386        outputs x, y coordinates of the detected center and None, None for
1387        the refined coordinates.
1388
1389        Returns
1390        -------
1391        x : float
1392            x-coordinate of the center detected via detection_method
1393        y : float
1394            y-coordinate of the center detected via detection_method
1395        xx : float
1396            x-coordinate of the center detected via refinement_method
1397        yy : float
1398            y-coordinate of the center detected via refinement_method
1399        """
1400        
1401        if self.ret == 1:
1402            # Convert to float
1403            if type(self.x) != float:
1404                self.x, self.y, self.xx, self.yy, self.r, self.rr = \
1405                    [float(value) for value in (self.x, self.y, 
1406                                                self.xx, self.yy, 
1407                                                self.r, self.rr)]
1408            
1409            # Round radius
1410            self.r, self.rr = np.round(self.r), np.round(self.rr)
1411            
1412            # Return values of center coordinates
1413            return (np.round(self.x,1), np.round(self.y,1), 
1414                    np.round(self.xx,1), np.round(self.yy,1))  
1415        else:
1416            # Convert to float
1417            if type(self.x) != float:
1418                self.x, self.y, self.r = \
1419                    [float(value) for value in (self.x, self.y, self.r)]
1420
1421            # Return values of center coordinates
1422            return (np.round(self.x,1), np.round(self.y,1), None, None)

1425    def ref_interactive(self, px, py, pr):
1426        ''' 
1427        Manual refinement of the detected diffraction pattern via one of 
1428        the methods provided in the class CircleDetection.
1429        
1430        The user can change the position of the center of the diffraction
1431        pattern and also the radius of the detected pattern using keys:
1432            - left / right / top / down arrows : move left / right / top / down
1433            - '+' : increase radius
1434            - '-' : decrease radius
1435            - 'd' : done, termination of the refinement
1436
1437        If the interactive figure is closed without any modifications,
1438        the function returns input variables and the proccess terminates.
1439        
1440        The results are shown in a figure when the refinement is successful.
1441
1442        Parameters
1443        ----------
1444        px : float64
1445            x-coordinate of the center
1446        py : float64
1447            y-coordinate of the center
1448        pr : float64
1449            radius of the circular diffraction pattern
1450
1451        Returns
1452        -------
1453        x : float64
1454            new x-coordinate of the center
1455        y : float64
1456            new y-coordinate of the center
1457        r : float64
1458            new radius of the circular diffraction pattern
1459        '''
1460        
1461        # Load original image
1462        im = np.copy(self.to_refine)
1463        
1464        # Initialize variables and flags
1465        xy = np.array((px, py))
1466        r = np.copy(pr)
1467        termination_flag = False
1468
1469        # User information:
1470        if self.messages:
1471            print(" ")
1472            print("--------------------------------------------------------------------------")
1473            print("Interactive refinement. Use these keys:")
1474            print("      - 'left arrow' : move left")
1475            print("      - 'right arrow' : move right")
1476            print("      - 'top arrow' : move up")
1477            print("      - 'bottom arrow' : move down")
1478            print("      - '+' : increase circle radius")
1479            print("      - '-' : decrease circle radius")
1480            print("      - 'd' : refinement done")
1481            print("DISCLAIMER: for the purpose of the center shift, the default shortcuts ")
1482            print("for left and right arrows were removed.")
1483            print("--------------------------------------------------------------------------")
1484        
1485        # Create a figure and display the image
1486        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 12))
1487        
1488        # Allow using arrows to move back and forth between view ports
1489        plt.rcParams['keymap.back'].append('left')
1490        plt.rcParams['keymap.forward'].append('right')
1491        
1492        circle = plt.Circle(
1493            (px, py), pr, color='r', fill=False)
1494        ax.add_artist(circle)
1495
1496        # Plot center point
1497        center, = ax.plot(px, py, 'rx', markersize=12)
1498                    
1499
1500        plt.title('Manually adjust the center position.', 
1501                  fontsize=20)
1502
1503        ax.imshow(im, cmap = self.cmap)
1504        ax.axis('off')
1505        
1506        # Enable interactive mode
1507        plt.ion()
1508        
1509
1510        # Display the image
1511        # fig.set_size_inches(self.fig_width, self.fig_height)
1512        plt.show(block=False)
1513        
1514        ### Define the event handler for figure close event
1515        def onclose(event):
1516            nonlocal termination_flag
1517            termination_flag = True
1518            if self.messages:
1519                print('Execution terminated.')
1520 
1521        # Connect the event handler to the figure close event
1522        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('close_event', onclose)
1523        
1524        # Define the callback function for key press events
1525        def onkeypress2(event):
1526            # Use nonlocal to modify the center position in the outer scope
1527            nonlocal xy, r, termination_flag
1528
1529            # OTHER KEYS USED IN INTERACTIVE FIGURES
1530            #   event.key == '1': select a point in self.detection_3points()
1531            #   event.key == '2': delete the last point in self.detection...
1532            #   event.key == '3': delete a point in self.detection...
1533            #   event.key == 'd': proceed in self.detection_3points()
1534            
1535            if event.key in ['up', 'down', 'left', 'right', '+', '-']:
1536                if event.key in ['+', '-']:
1537                    r += 1 if event.key == '+' else -1
1538                else:
1539                    # Perform shifts normally
1540                    if event.key == 'up':
1541                        xy[1] -= 0.5
1542                       # print('Moved up')
1543                    elif event.key == 'down':
1544                        xy[1] += 0.5
1545                       # print('Moved down')
1546                    elif event.key == 'left':
1547                        xy[0] -= 0.5
1548                       # print('Moved left')
1549                    elif event.key == 'right':
1550                        xy[0] += 0.5
1551                       # print('Moved right')
1552
1553            # Terminate the interactive refinement with 'd' key
1554            if event.key == 'd':
1555                termination_flag = True
1556                if self.messages:
1557                    print("--- Refinement done. ---")
1558
1559            # Update the plot with the new center position
1560            circle.set_center((xy[0], xy[1]))  # circle
1561            circle.set_radius(r)               # radius
1562            center.set_data([xy[0]], [xy[1]])  # center
1563
1564            plt.title("Manually adjust the center position.", fontsize=20)
1565         
1566            # Update the plot
1567            plt.draw() 
1568        
1569        # Disconnect the on_key_press1 event handler from the figure
1570        fig.canvas.mpl_disconnect(fig.canvas.manager.key_press_handler_id)
1571        
1572        # Connect the callback function to the key press event
1573        fig.canvas.mpl_connect('key_press_event', onkeypress2)
1574
1575        # Enable interaction mode
1576        plt.ion() 
1577               
1578        # Wait for 'd' key press or figure closure
1579        while not termination_flag:
1580            try:
1581                plt.waitforbuttonpress(timeout=0.1)
1582            except KeyboardInterrupt:
1583                # If the user manually closes the figure, terminate the loop
1584                termination_flag = True
1585         
1586        # Turn off interactive mode
1587        plt.ioff()
1588        
1589        # Display the final figure with the selected center position and radius
1590        plt.tight_layout()
1591
1592        plt.show(block=False)
1593        
1594        # If the termination_flag is True, stop the code
1595        if termination_flag: 
1596            plt.close()  # Close the figure
1597
1598        # Print results
1599        if self.messages:
1600            print("CenterEstimator :: manual detection + adjustment")
1601            print(f"Center coordinates: {xy[0]:.2f} {xy[1]:.2f}")
1602                       
1603        return xy[0], xy[1], r

1606    def ref_var(self, px, py, pr, plot_results = 0):
1607        '''         
1608        Adjust center coordinates of a detected circular diffraction pattern.
1609        The center adjustment is based on variance minimization.
1610        
1611        The 8-neighbourhood pixels (x) of the current center (o) 
1612        will be tested regarding the minimization:
1613    
1614        - x x x : (px - dx, py + dy) (px, py + dy) ( px + dx, py + dy)
1615    
1616        - x o x : (px - dx, py)      (px, py)      (px + dx, py)
1617    
1618        - x x x : (px - dx, py - dy) (px, py - dy) (px + dx, py - dy)
1619        
1620
1621        Parameters
1622        ----------
1623        self.image : array of uint8
1624            Input image in which the diffraction pattern is to be found
1625        px : float64
1626            x-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted
1627        py : float64
1628            y-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted
1629        pr : float64
1630            radius of the detected center
1631        plot_results : integer (default = 1)
1632            Plot Detected center. The default is 1.
1633        
1634        Returns
1635        -------
1636        px : array of int32
1637           corrected x-coordinates of pixels from circle border
1638        py : array of int32
1639            corrected y-coordinates of pixels from circle border
1640        pr : array of int32
1641            radius of the detected center
1642            
1643        '''
1644        
1645        # Store input for plot
1646        bckup = [np.copy(px), np.copy(py), np.copy(pr)]
1647        
1648        # Load image
1649        image = np.copy(self.image)
1650
1651        # Starting values to be modified 
1652        init_var = self.intensity_var(image, px, py, pr)
1653        min_intensity_var = self.intensity_var(image, px, py, pr)
1654        best_center = (np.copy(px), np.copy(py))
1655        best_radius = np.copy(pr)
1656    
1657        # Convergence criterion for termination of gradient optimization 
1658        # (1) small positive value that serves as a threshold to determine 
1659        #     when the optimization process has converged
1660        convergence_threshold = 0.1*min_intensity_var
1661        
1662        # (2) maximum number of iterations of optimization
1663        max_iterations = 10
1664        
1665        # (3) keep track of the number of consecutive iterations where there 
1666        #     is no improvement in the objective function beyond 
1667        #     the convergence threshold
1668        no_improvement_count = 0
1669    
1670    
1671        # iterative refinement of the center of a circle while keeping
1672        # the radius constant.
1673        step = 0.3
1674        neighbors = [(float(dx), float(dy))
1675            for dx in np.arange(-1, 1 + step, step)
1676            for dy in np.arange(-1, 1 + step, step)]
1677        
1678        for iteration in range(max_iterations):    
1679            # Refine center while keeping radius constant
1680            curr = self.intensity_var(image, 
1681                                      best_center[0], 
1682                                      best_center[1], 
1683                                      best_radius) 
1684            # Store intensity sums of the current center's neighborhood
1685            curr_intensity_var = []
1686            for dx, dy in neighbors:
1687                nx, ny = best_center[0] + dx, best_center[1] + dy
1688                # Check if the point is within the expanded search radius
1689                curr_intensity_var.append(self.intensity_var(image, 
1690                                                             nx, ny, 
1691                                                             best_radius))
1692            
1693            # Find the minimum value coordinates within curr_intensity_var
1694            cx, _ = np.unravel_index(np.argmin(curr_intensity_var),
1695                                     [len(curr_intensity_var),1])
1696                    
1697            # Check for improvement of criterion -- in each iteration just once,
1698            # as the algorithm checks the neighbourhood of the best center (in
1699            # each iteration, the center is updated if possible)
1700            if min(curr_intensity_var) <= min_intensity_var:                           
1701                min_intensity_var = max(curr_intensity_var)
1702                
1703                # Calculate the new best coordinates of the center
1704                n = neighbors[cx]
1705                (nx, ny) = tuple(map(lambda x, y: float(x) + float(y), 
1706                                     best_center, n))
1707                best_center = px, py = (np.copy(nx), np.copy(ny))
1708                
1709            # Update maximum intensity sum 
1710            min_intensity_var = self.intensity_var(image, 
1711                                                    best_center[0], 
1712                                                    best_center[1], 
1713                                                    best_radius) 
1714            
1715            # Refine radius if necessary while keeping the center position 
1716            # constant. It iterates through different radius adjustments to find
1717            # a radius that maximizes the intensity sum of pixels
1718            
1719            radi_intensity_var = []
1720            radii = np.arange(-1, 1 + step, step)
1721            for dr in radii:
1722                new_radius = best_radius + dr
1723                radi_intensity_var.append(self.intensity_var(image, 
1724                                                             best_center[0], 
1725                                                             best_center[1], 
1726                                                             new_radius))
1727                
1728            # Find the minimum value coordinates within curr_var
1729            rx, _ = np.unravel_index(np.argmin(radi_intensity_var),
1730                                      [len(radi_intensity_var),1])
1731            
1732            # Check for improvement of criterion
1733            if max(radi_intensity_var) < min_intensity_var:
1734                min_intensity_var = max(radi_intensity_var)
1735                
1736                n = radii[rx]
1737                nr = best_radius+n
1738                
1739                best_radius = pr = np.copy(nr)
1740
1741            
1742            # Check for convergence and improvement (termination conditions)
1743            impr = abs(min_intensity_var - curr)
1744            if impr < convergence_threshold:
1745                no_improvement_count += 1
1746                if no_improvement_count == 5:
1747                    break
1748        
1749        # Avoid incorrect/redundant refinement
1750        ## (1) swapped coordinates
1751        if ((bckup[0] > bckup[1] and not best_center[0] > best_center[1])
1752            or  (bckup[0] < bckup[1] and not best_center[0] < best_center[1])):
1753            best_center = best_center[::-1]
1754        
1755        ## (2) worsened final maximum intensity sum than the initial one
1756        if np.round(init_var,-2) < np.round(min_intensity_var,-2):
1757            print("Refinement redundant.")
1758            best_center = np.copy(bckup)
1759    
1760        # Print results
1761        if self.messages:
1762            print("CenterLocator: manual detection + adjustment:")
1763            print(f"Estimated center {px:.2f} {py:.2f}")
1764                
1765        return best_center[0], best_center[1], best_radius
1766    
1767    
1768    def ref_sum(self, px, py, pr, plot_results=1):
1769        ''' 
1770        Adjust center position based on gradient optimization method
1771        via maximization of intensity sum.
1772        
1773        The 8-neighbourhood pixels (x) of the current center (o) 
1774        will be tested regarding the maximization:
1775    
1776        - x x x : (px - dx, py + dy) (px, py + dy) ( px + dx, py + dy)
1777    
1778        - x o x : (px - dx, py)      (px, py)      (px + dx, py)
1779    
1780        - x x x : (px - dx, py - dy) (px, py - dy) (px + dx, py - dy)
1781        
1782    
1783        Parameters
1784        ----------
1785        px : float64
1786            x-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted.
1787        py : float64
1788            y-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted.
1789        pr : float64
1790            radius of the detected center.
1791        plot_results : int, optional
1792            Plot Detected center. 
1793            The default is 1.
1794    
1795        Returns  
1796        -------
1797        best_center[0] : float64
1798            Adjusted x-coordinate of the center.
1799        best_center[1] : float64
1800            Adjusted y-coordinate of the center.
1801        best_radius : float64
1802            The adjusted radius of the circular diffraction pattern.
1803        '''
1804        # Store input for plot via self.visualize_refinement()
1805        bckup = [np.copy(px), np.copy(py), np.copy(pr)]
1806
1807        # Image in which the center is refined
1808        image = np.copy(self.image)
1809
1810        # Starting values to be modified 
1811        init_sum = self.intensity_sum(image, px, py, pr)
1812        max_intensity_sum = self.intensity_sum(image, px, py, pr)
1813        best_center = (np.copy(px), np.copy(py))
1814        best_radius = np.copy(pr)
1815        
1816        # Convergence criterion for termination of gradient optimization 
1817        # (1) small positive value that serves as a threshold to determine 
1818        #     when the optimization process has converged
1819        convergence_threshold = 0.05*max_intensity_sum
1820        
1821        # (2) maximum number of iterations of optimization
1822        max_iterations = 50
1823        
1824        # (3) keep track of the number of consecutive iterations where there 
1825        #     is no improvement in the objective function beyond 
1826        #     the convergence threshold
1827        no_improvement_count = 0
1828         
1829        # iterative refinement of the center of a circle while keeping
1830        # the radius constant.
1831        step = 0.2
1832        neighbors = [(float(dx), float(dy))
1833            for dx in np.arange(-1.0, 1.0 + step, step)
1834            for dy in np.arange(-1.0, 1.0 + step, step)]
1835
1836        for iteration in range(max_iterations):    
1837            # Refine center while keeping radius constant
1838            curr = self.intensity_sum(image, 
1839                                      best_center[0], 
1840                                      best_center[1], 
1841                                      best_radius)
1842            
1843            # Store intensity sums of the current center's neighborhood
1844            curr_intensity_sum = []
1845            for dx, dy in neighbors:
1846                nx, ny = best_center[0] + dx, best_center[1] + dy
1847                # Check if the point is within the expanded search radius
1848                curr_intensity_sum.append(self.intensity_sum(image, 
1849                                                        nx, ny, 
1850                                                        best_radius))
1851            
1852            # Find the maximum value coordinates within curr_sum
1853            cx, _ = np.unravel_index(np.argmax(curr_intensity_sum),
1854                                     [len(curr_intensity_sum),1])
1855                    
1856            # Check for improvement of criterion -- in each iteration just once,
1857            # as the algorithm checks the neighbourhood of the best center (in
1858            # each iteration, the center is updated if possible)
1859            if max(curr_intensity_sum) > max_intensity_sum:                           
1860                max_intensity_sum = max(curr_intensity_sum)
1861                
1862                # Calculate the new best coordinates of the center
1863                n = neighbors[cx]
1864                (nx, ny) = tuple(map(lambda x, y: float(x) + float(y), 
1865                                     best_center, n))
1866                best_center = px, py = (np.copy(nx), np.copy(ny))
1867    
1868            # Update maximum intensity sum 
1869            max_intensity_sum = self.intensity_sum(image, 
1870                                                    best_center[0], 
1871                                                    best_center[1], 
1872                                                    best_radius)
1873
1874        
1875            # Refine radius if necessary while keeping the center position 
1876            # constant. It iterates through different radius adjustments to find
1877            # a radius that maximizes the intensity sum of pixels
1878            
1879            radi_intensity_sum = []
1880            radii = np.arange(-1.0, 1.0 + step, step)
1881            for dr in radii:
1882                new_radius = best_radius + dr
1883                radi_intensity_sum.append(self.intensity_sum(image, 
1884                                                            best_center[0], 
1885                                                            best_center[1], 
1886                                                            new_radius))
1887                
1888            # Find the maximum value coordinates within curr_sum
1889            rx, _ = np.unravel_index(np.argmax(radi_intensity_sum),
1890                                      [len(radi_intensity_sum),1])
1891
1892            # Check for improvement of criterion
1893            if max(radi_intensity_sum) > max_intensity_sum:
1894                max_intensity_sum = max(radi_intensity_sum)
1895                
1896                n = radii[rx]
1897                nr = best_radius+n
1898                
1899                best_radius = pr = np.copy(nr)
1900                
1901            
1902            # Check for convergence and improvement (termination conditions)
1903            impr = abs(max_intensity_sum - curr)
1904            if impr < convergence_threshold:
1905                no_improvement_count += 1
1906                if no_improvement_count == 25:
1907                    break
1908                
1909
1910        
1911        # Avoid incorrect/redundant refinement
1912        ## (1) swapped coordinates
1913        if ((bckup[0] > bckup[1] and not best_center[0] > best_center[1])
1914            or  (bckup[0] < bckup[1] and not best_center[0] < best_center[1])):
1915            best_center = best_center[::-1]
1916        
1917        ## (2) worsened final maximum intensity sum than the initial one
1918        if np.round(init_sum,-2) > np.round(max_intensity_sum,-2):
1919            print("Refinement redundant.")
1920            best_center = np.copy(bckup)
1921    
1922        # Print results
1923        if self.messages:
1924            print("CenterLocator: manual detection + adjustment:")
1925            print(f"Estimated center {px:.2f} {py:.2f}")
1926                
1927        return best_center[0], best_center[1], best_radius
1928

1930    def get_circle_pixels(self, xc, yc, radius, num_points=360):
1931        '''         
1932        Get coordinates of pixels defining circle border
1933    
1934        Parameters
1935        ----------
1936        self.image_path : str
1937            direct path to a image with diffraction patterns
1938        xc : float64
1939            x-coordinate of the detected center
1940        yc : float64
1941            y-coordinate of the detected center
1942        radius : float64
1943            radius of the detected center
1944        num_points : float64 
1945            number of border points. The default is 360
1946        
1947        Returns
1948        -------
1949        x : array of float64
1950            x-coordinates of pixels from circle border
1951        y : array of float64
1952            y-coordinates of pixels from circle border
1953            
1954        '''
1955        
1956        # Generate angles from 0 to 2*pi
1957        theta = np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, num=num_points)  
1958                
1959        # Calculate x,y-coordinates of points on the actual circle border
1960        x_actual = xc + radius * np.cos(theta)
1961        y_actual = yc + radius * np.sin(theta)
1962        
1963        return x_actual, y_actual
1964          
1965    
1966    def intensity_sum(self, image, px, py, pr):
1967        ''' 
1968        Summation of intensity values of pixels of a diffraction pattern.
1969
1970        Parameters
1971        ----------
1972        image : array of uint8
1973            image from which the diffraction pattern has been detected.
1974        px : float64
1975            x-coordinate of the center of the diffraction pattern.
1976        py : float64
1977            y-coordinate of the center of the diffraction pattern.
1978        pr : float64
1979            radius of the diffraction pattern.
1980
1981        Returns
1982        -------
1983        s : float64
1984            intensity sum
1985
1986        '''
1987        # Extract pixels on the circle border
1988        pxc, pyc = self.get_circle_pixels(px, py, pr)
1989        pxc = np.array(pxc, dtype=int)
1990        pyc = np.array(pyc, dtype=int)
1991        
1992        # Calculate sum using the filtered values
1993        s = np.sum(image[pyc, pxc])/len(pxc)
1994        return s
1995
1996   
1997    def intensity_var(self, image, px, py, pr):
1998        ''' 
1999        Variance of intensity values of pixels of a diffraction pattern.
2000
2001        Parameters
2002        ----------
2003        image : array of uint8
2004            image from which the diffraction pattern has been detected.
2005        px : float64
2006            x-coordinate of the center of the diffraction pattern.
2007        py : float64
2008            y-coordinate of the center of the diffraction pattern.
2009        pr : float64
2010            radius of the diffraction pattern.
2011
2012        Returns
2013        -------
2014        s : float64
2015            intensity variance
2016
2017        '''
2018        # Extract pixels on the circle border
2019        pxc, pyc = self.get_circle_pixels(px, py, pr)
2020        pxc = np.array(pxc, dtype=int)
2021        pyc = np.array(pyc, dtype=int)
2022        
2023        # Calculate sum using the filtered values
2024        s = np.var(image[pxc, pyc])
2025        return s

SUBCLASS of CircleEstimator

Automatic adjustment of the center position of diffraction patterns, which was found using methods defined in the class CircleDetection

Parameters
  • image_path (string): direct path to an image with diffraction patterns
  • detection_method (string): Selection of a method for center calculation. String codes are: - 'manual' : manual detection via 3 points - 'intensity' : detection via maximum intensity - 'hough' : automatic detection via Hough transform
  • correction_method (string): Selection of a method for center position correction. Default is None. String codes are: - 'manual' : manual corection - 'var' : correction via variance minimization - 'sum' : correction via sum maximization
  • heq (boolean): Allow histogram equalization. The default is 0 (no enhancement)
  • icut (boolean): Allow image enhancement. The default is 0 (no enhancement)
Returns
  • self.xx (int32): adjusted x-coordinate of the detected center
  • self.yy (int32): adjusted y-coordinate of the detected center
  • self.rr (int32): radius of the detected center

1211            # Enhance diffraction pattern to make it more visible

1213                if self.messages:

1231        # Hough transform: perform pre-processing necessary for the detection

1254

1257                                              sigma=0.2, 
1258                                              low_threshold=2.5*np.median(self.to_refine), 
1259                                              high_threshold=3*np.median(self.to_refine))
1260

1262                    selem = sk.morphology.disk(5)
1263                    dilated_edges = sk.morphology.dilation(edges, selem)
1264                    
1265                    # Erode the dilated edges to reduce thickness and smooth the contour

Function for input image preprocessing based on the methods defined in the class initialization - self.detection_method, self.correction_method.

Parameters

  • preHough (bool, optional): Perform preprocessing for automatic detection via Hough transform.

  • edges (array of bool): Detected edges via Canny detector for automatic Hough transform
