Manual refinement of the detected diffraction pattern via one of the methods provided in the class CircleDetection.

The user can change the position of the center of the diffraction pattern and also the radius of the detected pattern using keys: - left / right / top / down arrows : move left / right / top / down - '+' : increase radius - '-' : decrease radius - 'd' : done, termination of the refinement

If the interactive figure is closed without any modifications, the function returns input variables and the proccess terminates.

The results are shown in a figure when the refinement is successful.

Parameters
  • px (float64): x-coordinate of the center
  • py (float64): y-coordinate of the center
  • pr (float64): radius of the circular diffraction pattern
Returns
  • x (float64): new x-coordinate of the center
  • y (float64): new y-coordinate of the center
  • r (float64): new radius of the circular diffraction pattern
def ref_var(self, px, py, pr, plot_results=0): 
1606    def ref_var(self, px, py, pr, plot_results = 0):
1607        '''         
1608        Adjust center coordinates of a detected circular diffraction pattern.
1609        The center adjustment is based on variance minimization.
1610        
1611        The 8-neighbourhood pixels (x) of the current center (o) 
1612        will be tested regarding the minimization:
1613    
1614        - x x x : (px - dx, py + dy) (px, py + dy) ( px + dx, py + dy)
1615    
1616        - x o x : (px - dx, py)      (px, py)      (px + dx, py)
1617    
1618        - x x x : (px - dx, py - dy) (px, py - dy) (px + dx, py - dy)
1619        
1620
1621        Parameters
1622        ----------
1623        self.image : array of uint8
1624            Input image in which the diffraction pattern is to be found
1625        px : float64
1626            x-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted
1627        py : float64
1628            y-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted
1629        pr : float64
1630            radius of the detected center
1631        plot_results : integer (default = 1)
1632            Plot Detected center. The default is 1.
1633        
1634        Returns
1635        -------
1636        px : array of int32
1637           corrected x-coordinates of pixels from circle border
1638        py : array of int32
1639            corrected y-coordinates of pixels from circle border
1640        pr : array of int32
1641            radius of the detected center
1642            
1643        '''
1644        
1645        # Store input for plot
1646        bckup = [np.copy(px), np.copy(py), np.copy(pr)]
1647        
1648        # Load image
1649        image = np.copy(self.image)
1650
1651        # Starting values to be modified 
1652        init_var = self.intensity_var(image, px, py, pr)
1653        min_intensity_var = self.intensity_var(image, px, py, pr)
1654        best_center = (np.copy(px), np.copy(py))
1655        best_radius = np.copy(pr)
1656    
1657        # Convergence criterion for termination of gradient optimization 
1658        # (1) small positive value that serves as a threshold to determine 
1659        #     when the optimization process has converged
1660        convergence_threshold = 0.1*min_intensity_var
1661        
1662        # (2) maximum number of iterations of optimization
1663        max_iterations = 10
1664        
1665        # (3) keep track of the number of consecutive iterations where there 
1666        #     is no improvement in the objective function beyond 
1667        #     the convergence threshold
1668        no_improvement_count = 0
1669    
1670    
1671        # iterative refinement of the center of a circle while keeping
1672        # the radius constant.
1673        step = 0.3
1674        neighbors = [(float(dx), float(dy))
1675            for dx in np.arange(-1, 1 + step, step)
1676            for dy in np.arange(-1, 1 + step, step)]
1677        
1678        for iteration in range(max_iterations):    
1679            # Refine center while keeping radius constant
1680            curr = self.intensity_var(image, 
1681                                      best_center[0], 
1682                                      best_center[1], 
1683                                      best_radius) 
1684            # Store intensity sums of the current center's neighborhood
1685            curr_intensity_var = []
1686            for dx, dy in neighbors:
1687                nx, ny = best_center[0] + dx, best_center[1] + dy
1688                # Check if the point is within the expanded search radius
1689                curr_intensity_var.append(self.intensity_var(image, 
1690                                                             nx, ny, 
1691                                                             best_radius))
1692            
1693            # Find the minimum value coordinates within curr_intensity_var
1694            cx, _ = np.unravel_index(np.argmin(curr_intensity_var),
1695                                     [len(curr_intensity_var),1])
1696                    
1697            # Check for improvement of criterion -- in each iteration just once,
1698            # as the algorithm checks the neighbourhood of the best center (in
1699            # each iteration, the center is updated if possible)
1700            if min(curr_intensity_var) <= min_intensity_var:                           
1701                min_intensity_var = max(curr_intensity_var)
1702                
1703                # Calculate the new best coordinates of the center
1704                n = neighbors[cx]
1705                (nx, ny) = tuple(map(lambda x, y: float(x) + float(y), 
1706                                     best_center, n))
1707                best_center = px, py = (np.copy(nx), np.copy(ny))
1708                
1709            # Update maximum intensity sum 
1710            min_intensity_var = self.intensity_var(image, 
1711                                                    best_center[0], 
1712                                                    best_center[1], 
1713                                                    best_radius) 
1714            
1715            # Refine radius if necessary while keeping the center position 
1716            # constant. It iterates through different radius adjustments to find
1717            # a radius that maximizes the intensity sum of pixels
1718            
1719            radi_intensity_var = []
1720            radii = np.arange(-1, 1 + step, step)
1721            for dr in radii:
1722                new_radius = best_radius + dr
1723                radi_intensity_var.append(self.intensity_var(image, 
1724                                                             best_center[0], 
1725                                                             best_center[1], 
1726                                                             new_radius))
1727                
1728            # Find the minimum value coordinates within curr_var
1729            rx, _ = np.unravel_index(np.argmin(radi_intensity_var),
1730                                      [len(radi_intensity_var),1])
1731            
1732            # Check for improvement of criterion
1733            if max(radi_intensity_var) < min_intensity_var:
1734                min_intensity_var = max(radi_intensity_var)
1735                
1736                n = radii[rx]
1737                nr = best_radius+n
1738                
1739                best_radius = pr = np.copy(nr)
1740
1741            
1742            # Check for convergence and improvement (termination conditions)
1743            impr = abs(min_intensity_var - curr)
1744            if impr < convergence_threshold:
1745                no_improvement_count += 1
1746                if no_improvement_count == 5:
1747                    break
1748        
1749        # Avoid incorrect/redundant refinement
1750        ## (1) swapped coordinates
1751        if ((bckup[0] > bckup[1] and not best_center[0] > best_center[1])
1752            or  (bckup[0] < bckup[1] and not best_center[0] < best_center[1])):
1753            best_center = best_center[::-1]
1754        
1755        ## (2) worsened final maximum intensity sum than the initial one
1756        if np.round(init_var,-2) < np.round(min_intensity_var,-2):
1757            print("Refinement redundant.")
1758            best_center = np.copy(bckup)
1759    
1760        # Print results
1761        if self.messages:
1762            print("CenterLocator: manual detection + adjustment:")
1763            print(f"Estimated center {px:.2f} {py:.2f}")
1764                
1765        return best_center[0], best_center[1], best_radius

Adjust center coordinates of a detected circular diffraction pattern. The center adjustment is based on variance minimization.

The 8-neighbourhood pixels (x) of the current center (o) will be tested regarding the minimization:

  • x x x : (px - dx, py + dy) (px, py + dy) ( px + dx, py + dy)

  • x o x : (px - dx, py) (px, py) (px + dx, py)

  • x x x : (px - dx, py - dy) (px, py - dy) (px + dx, py - dy)

Parameters
  • self.image (array of uint8): Input image in which the diffraction pattern is to be found
  • px (float64): x-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted
  • py (float64): y-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted
  • pr (float64): radius of the detected center
  • plot_results (integer (default = 1)): Plot Detected center. The default is 1.
Returns
  • px (array of int32): corrected x-coordinates of pixels from circle border
  • py (array of int32): corrected y-coordinates of pixels from circle border
  • pr (array of int32): radius of the detected center

Adjust center position based on gradient optimization method via maximization of intensity sum.

The 8-neighbourhood pixels (x) of the current center (o) will be tested regarding the maximization:

  • x x x : (px - dx, py + dy) (px, py + dy) ( px + dx, py + dy)

  • x o x : (px - dx, py) (px, py) (px + dx, py)

  • x x x : (px - dx, py - dy) (px, py - dy) (px + dx, py - dy)

Parameters
  • px (float64): x-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted.
  • py (float64): y-coordinate of the detected center to be adjusted.
  • pr (float64): radius of the detected center.
  • plot_results (int, optional): Plot Detected center. The default is 1.
Returns

best_center[0] : float64 Adjusted x-coordinate of the center. best_center[1] : float64 Adjusted y-coordinate of the center. best_radius : float64 The adjusted radius of the circular diffraction pattern.

def get_circle_pixels(self, xc, yc, radius, num_points=360): 
1930    def get_circle_pixels(self, xc, yc, radius, num_points=360):
1931        '''         
1932        Get coordinates of pixels defining circle border
1933    
1934        Parameters
1935        ----------
1936        self.image_path : str
1937            direct path to a image with diffraction patterns
1938        xc : float64
1939            x-coordinate of the detected center
1940        yc : float64
1941            y-coordinate of the detected center
1942        radius : float64
1943            radius of the detected center
1944        num_points : float64 
1945            number of border points. The default is 360
1946        
1947        Returns
1948        -------
1949        x : array of float64
1950            x-coordinates of pixels from circle border
1951        y : array of float64
1952            y-coordinates of pixels from circle border
1953            
1954        '''
1955        
1956        # Generate angles from 0 to 2*pi
1957        theta = np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, num=num_points)  
1958                
1959        # Calculate x,y-coordinates of points on the actual circle border
1960        x_actual = xc + radius * np.cos(theta)
1961        y_actual = yc + radius * np.sin(theta)
1962        
1963        return x_actual, y_actual

def intensity_sum(self, image, px, py, pr): 
1966    def intensity_sum(self, image, px, py, pr):
1967        ''' 
1968        Summation of intensity values of pixels of a diffraction pattern.
1969
1970        Parameters
1971        ----------
1972        image : array of uint8
1973            image from which the diffraction pattern has been detected.
1974        px : float64
1975            x-coordinate of the center of the diffraction pattern.
1976        py : float64
1977            y-coordinate of the center of the diffraction pattern.
1978        pr : float64
1979            radius of the diffraction pattern.
1980
1981        Returns
1982        -------
1983        s : float64
1984            intensity sum
1985
1986        '''
1987        # Extract pixels on the circle border
1988        pxc, pyc = self.get_circle_pixels(px, py, pr)
1989        pxc = np.array(pxc, dtype=int)
1990        pyc = np.array(pyc, dtype=int)
1991        
1992        # Calculate sum using the filtered values
1993        s = np.sum(image[pyc, pxc])/len(pxc)
1994        return s

class IntensityCenter: 
2111class IntensityCenter: 
2112    '''
2113    Simple center determination for a symmetric diffractogram.
2114    
2115    * The center is determined as a center of intensity.
2116    * This works well for simple, symmetric diffraction patters, which are:
2117      (i) without beamstopper, (ii) pre-centered, and (iii) powder-like.
2118    * A real-life example of a simple symmetric diffractogram:
2119      a good powder electron diffraction pattern from STEMDIFF software.
2120    * This class is a legacy from previous EDIFF versions;
2121      it is kept mostly for backward compatibility.
2122      The functions in this class can be (and should be)
2123      replaced by a simple call of ediff.center.CenterLocator object.
2124      
2125    >>> # Center determination in a simple symmetric diffraction pattern
2126    >>> # (center = just center_of_intensity, no refinement
2127    >>>
2128    >>> # (1) Old way = this (old, legacy) IntensityCenter class:
2129    >>> xc,yc = ediff.center.IntensityCenter.center_of_intensity(
2130    >>>     arr, csquare=30, cintensity=0.8)
2131    >>>
2132    >>> # (2) New way = newer (and more universal) CenterLocator class:
2133    >>> xc,yc = ediff.center.CenterLocator(
2134    >>>     arr, detection_method='intensity', csquare=30, cintensity=0.8)
2135    '''
2136    
2137    @staticmethod
2138    def center_of_intensity(arr, csquare=20, cintensity=0.8):
2139        '''
2140        Find center of intensity/mass of an array.
2141        
2142        Parameters
2143        ----------
2144        arr : 2D-numpy array
2145            The array, whose intensity center will be determined.
2146        csquare : int, optional, default is 20
2147            The size/edge of the square in the (geometrical) center.
2148            The intensity center is searched only within the central square.
2149            Reasons: To avoid other spots/diffractions and
2150            to minimize the effect of an intensity assymetry around center. 
2151        cintensity : float, optional, default is 0.8
2152            The intensity fraction.
2153            When searching the intensity center, we will consider only
2154            pixels with intensity > max.intensity.
2155            
2156        Returns
2157        -------
2158        xc,yc : float,float
2159            XY-coordinates of the intensity/mass center of the array.
2160            Round XY-coordinates if you use them for image/array calculations.    
2161        '''
2162        # Get image/array size
2163        xsize,ysize = arr.shape
2164        # Calculate borders around the central square
2165        xborder = (xsize - csquare) // 2
2166        yborder = (ysize - csquare) // 2
2167        # Create central square = cut off the borders
2168        arr2 = arr[xborder:-xborder,yborder:-yborder].copy()
2169        # In the central square, set all values below cintenstity to zero
2170        arr2 = np.where(arr2>np.max(arr2)*cintensity, arr2, 0)
2171        # Calculate 1st central moments of the image
2172        M = sk.measure.moments(arr2,1)
2173        # Calculate the intensity center = centroid according to www-help
2174        (xc,yc) = (M[1,0]/M[0,0], M[0,1]/M[0,0])
2175        # We have centroid of the central square => recalculate to whole image
2176        (xc,yc) = (xc+xborder,yc+yborder)
2177        
2178        ## Return the final center
2179        return(xc,yc)

Simple center determination for a symmetric diffractogram.

  • The center is determined as a center of intensity.
  • This works well for simple, symmetric diffraction patters, which are: (i) without beamstopper, (ii) pre-centered, and (iii) powder-like.
  • A real-life example of a simple symmetric diffractogram: a good powder electron diffraction pattern from STEMDIFF software.
  • This class is a legacy from previous EDIFF versions; it is kept mostly for backward compatibility. The functions in this class can be (and should be) replaced by a simple call of CenterLocator object.
>>> # Center determination in a simple symmetric diffraction pattern
>>> # (center = just center_of_intensity, no refinement
>>>
>>> # (1) Old way = this (old, legacy) IntensityCenter class:
>>> xc,yc = IntensityCenter.center_of_intensity(
>>>     arr, csquare=30, cintensity=0.8)
>>>
>>> # (2) New way = newer (and more universal) CenterLocator class:
>>> xc,yc = CenterLocator(
>>>     arr, detection_method='intensity', csquare=30, cintensity=0.8)

Find center of intensity/mass of an array.

Parameters
  • arr (2D-numpy array): The array, whose intensity center will be determined.
  • csquare (int, optional, default is 20): The size/edge of the square in the (geometrical) center. The intensity center is searched only within the central square. Reasons: To avoid other spots/diffractions and to minimize the effect of an intensity assymetry around center.
  • cintensity (float, optional, default is 0.8): The intensity fraction. When searching the intensity center, we will consider only pixels with intensity > max.intensity.
Returns
  • xc,yc (float,float): XY-coordinates of the intensity/mass center of the array. Round XY-coordinates if you use them for image/array calculations.
